7lDg_VajoDjOaUEzY7Jpng.text: I've been a few places and this it seriously the best Pho I've ever had. Great service and one hell of a friendly crew. Highly recommended.

rBvqqGU6cxzUPnbb2idLXQ.text: Probably the best Pho north of Indian School.  We typically have to drive down to get good Pho.  Place is clean, ambiance is good, and great service.  Broth was flavorful and spring rolls with peanut sauce was great too.  Will be back for sure to try some of their other menu items (clay pot, and lemon grass dishes).

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eRf0jwIG8w-PqZGslJGnXA.text: Just checked some of the reviews.  I totally agree with all the negative reviews....the food is marginal (it's okay if you don't want to drive further south for better, more authentic Vietnamese food!!!), but the service is absolutely HORRIBLE! Someone told me that Diner, Drive In and Dives was there and they gave them a good review...... Well of course! They probably pulled out all of the stops for them!!! However, maybe because of this review, they think they don't have to treat regular customers with respect and some courtesy!!!! This is a service oriented business and they really need to re-train their staff.  Maybe it's because the owner is just as bad and they just follow her lead.  She better get her act together, otherwise, when other Vietnamese restaurants open up closer to hers, she will definitely see a decline in her business!!! Hope she is reading and taking notes on all of her reviews!!!!!

NvzD9g7nE5J9Tdh4BOiVAQ.text: Great service, even better food. If you are in town looking for something else other than brewery style resto food.  We were glad to have visited this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Came in early just before the rush

kGXsqfUKsxynThvmRu-4vg.text: Outstanding food and service! My company and I had the rare steak pho (pho tai) and we were very impressed by the food. The broth tasted very authentic and we appreciated that. The service also impressed my party. The wait staff were all smiles appeared to be having a good time which made the environment warm and relaxing.   We will definitely be back again!

HA86oDUjnRNCBICgWze8QQ.text: Food is delicious, everyone that works here is very attentive and friendly. The Firecracker shrimps and garlic noodles are my favorite!! The shaken beef and clay pots are incredible too.  PS- It's kind of absurd to rate a place one star when you're admittedly a picky eater, you're eating something you have never tried before and because they couldn't identify the spice in the food YOU didn't liked? I'm as surprised that review made it too.

qhrljoBiRbiR48ZQSi-3cg.text: Slanted Rice is a small more-or-less Vietnamese restaurant located in the Hilton Village outdoor mall, near its north end.  It has all of the ingredients it needs to be a great addition to the Scottsdale dining scene, except for what I call "food design".  For example, the Drunken Beef - basically filet mignon cubes with fried onions - had a big problem: the beef was tough and chewy, probably because they used the filet mignon tips, or possibly because the meat was not filet mignon at all.  The crispy rice bowl with chicken was a smallish bowl of cripsy rice, but it came with such a scarcity of chicken and vegetables that it wasn't much beyond the rice.  The chicken that was there was dried out.  There were other issues with the food as well.  The free broth served with the meal was bland except for a strange almost cinnamon taste.  The egg rolls were small and the filling was mushy.  Although prices at Slanted Rice are not high (our entrees were $16 and $20), the portions are small and the value is barely there.  On the other hand, service was good, the menu was interesting, and the ambiance was inviting, but that was not enough to make up for the food, which was passable at best.

bHYljuIdw5Btwr_KCSl4cQ.text: One of the best Thai/Vietnamese food we ever had!! And we were visiting from N.Y. The ambience was beautiful and our server was the best ever!! Highly recommend this place!!

E95FjrN8rbahZ9go6fc0XQ.text: A nice tiny restaurant in Scottsdale. They had plenty of options for vegetarians. However since the restaurant is small, it doesn't take that many customers to overwhelm the staff or the kitchen. My experience there was pretty good, we decided to sit outside in order to get some space. We felt that sitting inside when it's crowded makes you feel like everyone is sitting right next to each other. Not enough space. It took a while to get our food. However, it was delicious and we had no bad complaints. The second time we decided to go to this restaurant, we came in and almost every table except for two and the outside area was taken. It was already past 7:30. The waitress at the front informed us that it would be almost 40 minutes before we could even get our orders to the kitchen because of a large group that was there that night (maybe a group of 8-10). Since the restaurant closed at 9, we decided to leave and went to a different place. I recommend people try the food, but be prepared if the place is busy. It can cause the staff to go into overdrive and takes longer to get food out. Also don't get the spring rolls, they tasted frozen.

ah7UWUPH8zkrae6lTBDbHg.text: when i dine here i always sit up at the bar and the service is exceptional.  The food is great. my sister digs the firecracker shrimp with garlic noodles. we both love the spring shrimp rolls.  wonderful presentation too! the decor is pleasant and the vibe is great.  i would definitely recommend this little gem of a place tucked behine chase bank.  even though you will like one dish, force yourself to try something new every visit, it's worth it.

96DThCgkeeXANChVThIcJg.text: I came here for dinner with family while on vacation.  The food was very good, considering I didn't expect there's much ethnic food out here in the desert.    I stuck to ordering a few appetizers to try as many plates as I could.    The vegetarian spring rolls were really good.  Crisp, fresh, and a nice dipping sauce on the side.  They normally come with two, but I asked to have them cut it into 3, and they were happy to oblige.    The sweet fish sauce chicken wings were generous portion wise, and were nice mix of flavors. Sweet, salty, spicy, and sour.  I was hoping it had more of a fish sauce flavor, because the sweetness overwhelmed the dish.  Avoid ordering the Brussel sprouts.  They overcharred the veggies, and while the fish sauce offered a balance to the smokiness, there's too many bitter charred pieces. I prefer them less well done.  We also ordered a Bun Cha Hanoi, which was the house specialty vermicelli. Charbroiled beef, pork patties, and shrimp with fish sauce vinaigrette and greens. Great mix of flavors.  Overall a really great food experience.  Service was great as well.  I'd come back if I visit the Phoenix Scottsdale area.

gD1NG07UbQT5jvEKrULwEA.text: We are such PHO snobs!  I cannot tell you how impressive the menu was! The menu had an eclectic menu of various spring rolls and multiple options for pho. The atmosphere is so fun: adorable chandeliers and private booths. The service is wonderful and we were beyond impressed with the menu! If you love pho, you'll love this place!!!

fHUGzbMWv5lQ2jPOlFog7A.text: Tried there shaken beef last night, three words ! Tender, Juicy ! And Amazing! The tenderloin comes over sizzling over Carmelized onions. The staff there is really awesome as well, cute little neighborhood restaurant, seems like the staff knows all its customers and makes everyone feel at home, this will be my new rotation of restaurants to go to!

MMXjcWr-l0ttTBfTRR5ykw.text: World traveler who eats Pho all the time. This place I give 4 Stars for the Pho. It was good lots of flavor but can't give it a full Five. Gave 5 stars for the atmosphere, trendy laid back and awesome music.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Qg6rEwlh8Um_T7k2a1N7AA.text: Some of the best food in town. Pho is exceptional. Wings are tasty. Shaken beef is a MUST. Great friendly staff. Good for takeout or dine in... love this place

_zUcSuJOGOeDi4HWzn9A6g.text: There food is amazing , but they are extremely overpriced. They charge $8 for two sides of rice. Ridiculous

OgsxBpXc9cvgQ6vuQcqBiw.text: My new favorite Asian restaurant! I've tried about everything on the menu & everything is so delicious. Great service! I'm so happy I found this place & I will be coming here all the time now

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet mignon! So amazing
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rice &amp; garlic edemame
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pho chicken soup

ody25_m_jXzjjUhlYsLAxQ.text: Food was tasty. We had the charbroiled beef and the shrimp garlic noddles which were delicious, but somewhat overdone - both the beef and the shrimp. Waitress was fabulous and very accommodating. But it was probably too late to go. We were there at 8:00 pm and the meal took forever to come and they forgot the soup and salad until they brought it with the main dish. And actually it was expensive for two entrees, no drinks at $45!  We would go back, but earlier in the evening to try it again.

re5vCYiDmmUncvOcJfl4dQ.text: We are from out of town (Canada) with a strong Vietnamese community and good Vietnamese food. We were very pleased with our experience here.   Server suggested excellent choices and we were left holding our stomach and leftovers back to the hotel.   We tried the shaken beef; clay pot for mains. Appies were Brussels sprouts and the spring rolls.   All very tasty and will be back again.

Bm74PB4WX1wLnUeX5D31mA.text: Try the Garlic Noodles!! Literally the best noodles ever! The garlic is not overwhelming, but distributed evenly throughout the dish, with a lovely buttery taste! My new comfort food :)  Not your typical Vietnamese restaurant. Has a fancy feel to it.   And the staff, so friendly and welcoming!

8AUu2kmURps1AnPbxSeCMQ.text: We found a new spot for dining in Scottsdale! It's a great venue with tasty food and a super-friendly manager, Hue ("way"). The wife got the shaking beef, which was amazing. I got the chargrilled pork with rice, which was very good. The Vietnamese coffee is strong and not too sweet, just like I like it. Lunch soup is their pho broth, which is great, so the pho should also be very good.  A nice, clean modern interior with a long bar for neighborly chatting and an exterior patio make for two excellent eating environments. And don't forget about their happy hour that runs from 1-6pm or something like that. Bonus!

Mlc6eTmFQNEZhIqGwYuxQg.text: Slanted Rice is our go to Vietnamese Restaurant. in town. All of their food is absolutely delicious although for carry out we usually only get the pho as the other food gets soggy. Make sure to try their sticky rice it's the best. The only negative to this restaurant is that their phones never seem to work and it's impossible to get carry out called in when it's busy. But overall if you're looking for a great Vietnamese food this is the place.

ucnPZDMqjQ4ZB6Tvcm3Gvw.text: Super happy to have found a good place for pho in Scottsdale! I've felt like there aren't enough options in the area but with this addition I hope that is changing. I alternate between the meatball and chicken and always add extra veggies. The service is prompt, the space is clean, and the prices are super affordable. This is our go to spot when we're in town and craving comfort food but don't want to cook. My husband swears by their curry dishes and egg rolls. They have a awesome assortment of spring roll and other traditionally inspired appetizers as well. Oh and did I mention they have a full bar? The place has great range, perfect for lunch on a random Tuesday or a fun Friday dinner and drinks with friends.

c3xkPfl7XjkR7gEgGAhy5g.text: My mother and I came to this Vietnamese restaurant before doing some errands. It was a late lunch at 2:30-3:30 PM. My mom had been wanting to try Pha & she did some online research to choose Slanted Rice. We got seated right away, the place is small and super cute. We placed our drink orders; Thai ice tea & Thai iced coffee, which was forgotten. Water glasses filled a couple times & I reminded the waitress we still needed our drinks. She was very sweet and brought them promptly. The drinks were the best part of the entire meal.  My mom ordered the meatball pho and I ordered a tropical spring roll.  Tropical spring roll was 90% lettuce with a little bit of shrimp, avocado and mango. The rice wrap was chewy and the dipping sauce had no flavor. Mom's pho was bland, rice noodles mushy and she said the meatballs tasted old. I've had pha before, I tasted the broth and it was bland in comparison to   Pha I've had before. There was no chili oil to drizzle. I could not bring myself to try the meatballs, they just look like pale gray spheres floating in the bland broth with a weird mushy texture. We ordered tempura shrimp and garlic noodles as well as chicken pho to-go to bring home to some family members.  Comments from family on to-go dishes: Chicken pho broth flavorless & chicken tasted old/leftover/not fresh. Tempura shrimp & garlic noodles my son just ate the shrimp. He stated the garlic noodles were dry, chewy with no flavor & tasted as if it had Parmesan cheese in it. I took a taste & agreed. The bill was almost $80 and there was not 1 dish we liked. The drinks were delicious.  How unfortunate:(

xXeL7SieMLDJzbPmEF4Lsw.text: I have this odd flavor stuck in my mouth... I love pho but this pho was nothing like my Vietnamese friends make. Just not a good pho experience...my coke was watered down...for the location I expected better...

uyw5caJr7ZEuO2FkpEBY_Q.text: had dinner on a Saturday night and got in around 6pm before they got to crazy. Great service from everyone all around..  Ordered the Crispy rice in the clay pot with chicken and it was great. My cousin ordered the same thing and they loved it so much they tried going back the next day but told them they are too busy to take orders for take out. Not sure what that is about but a good way to lose customers fast. Lots of restaurants close down after being on DDD because they do not know how to handle it the craziness and probably dont know how to handle the books.. dont turn away customers!!!

PhrL8OFiNU0eeMxp3AlqVQ.text: Best Vietnamese in Phoenix valley. Amazing flavors. Good wait staff. Did I mention the flavors and smell?  #AMAZING. We enjoyed Shaken beef, pho ba, shrimp tempura roll, lemon soda.

GkXrQq2LTAmFuegqeZqaKQ.text: This place was bad in just about every category.   The service was really slow. It seemed like they had one server for the entire place on a weekend?   The prices were very high. $4 for one spring roll. Enough said.   The food was bland. Previously mentioned roll tasted only like mint. Pho broth tasted more or less like water.   The one redeeming item was the firecracker shrimp. Very tasty. Not sure how they managed that...but it was still expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The only good thing in the restaurant.

dNN3cXn2gdH90YA_AfNsHQ.text: Was sitting at the bar with my wife and was taken back when the wife of the owner called a patron a Bitch....totally unacceptable... Under any circumstance !!

TyXv3H1AFRRXe6_oc-qbNQ.text: I visited here on a Sunday early afternoon which is Pho O'Clock in my book.  Nothing better than pho to revive you from a Saturday night out about town.  I had the egg rolls as appetizer and the steak pho.  Both were good but somehow lacking inspiration and missing an element of authenticity that I can't quite put my finger on. Too many other pho options in the Phoenix area that are better to make a return visit.

ti7GEfsjcSW31UnI8jfG5w.text: Stopped by for some pho on this cold night!! The pho here is pretty good, the flank meat is very good, but the steak pho is beyond horrible, tough and chewy and not good. The meatballs and flank steak were all really good though!! So my recommendation is to get the combination without steak. The atmosphere is good with good music but I felt like I was in a high school locker room with the waitresses talking and gossiping together...they were talking pretty loud about their trips coming up and their boyfriends...obviously a place I could never take my parents to even they have been looking for a pho place. Not professional environment at all...food is solid 4 stars and the gossip makes the environment 2 stars...

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pho is really good if you take the steak out...the flank beef is really good though and broth is perfect!!!
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The pork and shrimp spring roll...it&#39;s reasonable...
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The front of the place!!

USbaOZB7WWD4DbGvFg7NjQ.text: I was a fan of this place! As we walked in, the interior definitely surprised us. It looked modern trendy and has some pretty hip, techno, pop music playing. Lights were low and some cool chandeliers lit up the place just enough to give a romantic ambience. There were a few couples, not too packed for a Monday evening, although enough people.  Took about 5 minutes of nobody greeting us at the host stand that we just decided to walk to the bar to ask if we needed to seat ourselves. The bartender welcomed us and asked us to join him to watch the Grammies but we opted to sit at a table. In fairness, it was 8:05pm- and they close at 8:45/9.  A server came to give us menus and ask us for our order. All else with the service seemed fine- wasn't stellar, wasn't bad. We ordered shrimp and pork spring rolls, the tenderloin and vegetable pho and the combination pho. Took about 5 minutes for the rolls and another 7 for the Pho which was nice. Was served with the typical sides and hoisin along with 2 chile pastes.   The pho was Goooood!   The server took until we were paging for the meal to offer more water, which was unfortunate. I also wanted more lime but she didn't come back until I was close to being done. It was fine.  Overall good experience and good food. I would be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combination pho before I mixed in all my yummies!
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork and shrimp spring roll
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View at entry

MgOMBc0j1_5iprsMVqEJCg.text: Fancy decor and Vietnamese cuisine don't often happen in the same sentence, but this place is a fabulously decorated Vietnamese restaurant!  They have this cool lighted tree branch sculpture/chandelier that was really mesmerizing.  The restaurant itself was not that large and somewhat narrow.  But it's still able to fit a lot of people, we came with a large group of 20+ people!  I wasn't that hungry, so I ordered the clay pot rice with veggies and tofu to share with my friend.  It came with soup and salad, and we were able to order extra soup and salad for $3 so each of us could have some.  The salad and soup were tasty, although the soup less impressive than the salad and the soup kind of had too many chives in it.  The clay pot rice was great!  I loved how the clay pot made some of the rice hard and chewy at the bottom of the pot.  The tofu and veggies were also good.  My favorite part was the mushrooms, I wish they had added more of those!  Overall great experience and I would come again, but I will note that I wish they had better ventilation.  With all of the steamy dishes being cooked in the kitchen, the place was getting smoky and hazy inside.  And when I went home my hair and clothes all smelled of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Clay pot rice with veggies and tofu. You can&#39;t see the steam but it was steaming hot!

g6uMc_t8cKaV6UPmKP8tVg.text: Amazing Vietnamese food! But if taste alone could suffice a dinning experience, no one would eat out. Place closes @9pm. Advice - don't go after 7:30pm. Staff looked not interested. Won't offer table even if there are a few people at the restaurant, reason given waiter is already behind on tables. Poor gentleman behind us fell badly slipping on unswept food. Wish someone would have made sure he was ok. Staff will give a warning for the last call for food without even offering a menu. Wish the service does justice to the quality of food this place has to offer.

CmnQePRhNp5d-l53dOQJ3w.text: Food was good but the service was pretty bad. The lady who took our order didn't write it down and forgot to put it in the system. When she notified us she didn't seem too apologetic. No one was rude, just seems like they need to be better organized as food was being delivered to the wrong table multiple times as well. When prices are this high for a bowl of pho, the experience should've been better. Hopefully when the owners push "cool" on this, they will also fix the problem.

knNOQlaoVSv09GDDmORUYw.text: We had a fabulous lunch on the patio. We had vegetarian pho, salt and pepper shrimp and vegetarian spring rolls. Seriously, so fresh, so flavorful, and absolutely delish. Highly recommend.

GQl12llATAROU-smJ-ndjA.text: Walked in for lunch, had a great experience. I felt the service was very friendly and helpful. I don't know much about Vietnamese food, so I cannot say how authentic it is. Nonetheless, the flavors were delicious and I will definitely be back. It's a bit of a splurge for a guy who usually gets some take out for lunch in the $8 to $12 range. I had the filet sizzling platter and it came out great. Normally I don't like my food to still be cooking when it arrives but the flavors melded well between the meat, onions and sauce. If it were closer I would quickly become a regular here.

P5pMsBTCbd2Nd0Utwxy9TA.text: I have tried this place a few times and find it to be overpriced and the pho "just okay".... service is always good tho. I would like them to have a richer broth rather than a plain not so tasty (almost watery) pho broth. There are a few good pho places around and I would only come here if I really am on a time crunch.  The atmosphere is great though, I love the decor and like I said the service is always good as well.

9dE4VGp_7aXle0SvmeqcmQ.text: This place has a nice ambiance that reminds me of a nice Vegas restaurant with it's upscale mix of a classic and modern style. I ordered the shaken beef and loved the sauce, filet, and onions that come with the dish. The portions are very filling with the salad and broth that come with the meal. It's hard to beat the price with filet mignon at $16 for the lunch meal. I also tried some of my cousin's chicken clay pot meal and it was delicious as well.   The service was as good as the food. Our server Priscilla was friendly, prompt, and made sure we were taken care of the whole time. I've been spoiled with great Vietnamese food in San Diego, so it's nice to find a gem like this in the valley. I'll definitely be back, and the the only difficult part will be deciding which dish to try next!

hp1izENcw92mpv6eg4msPQ.text: Personally ,Vietnamese food is my soul food,it makes me feel home,cheers me up when sad and what not.Am super emotionally attached to the flavors and warmth of Vietnamese cuisine.This place is anything but authentic Vietnamese restaurant.Its fancy,it has presentations but trust me its way far from authentic Vietnamese flavor.  a)We ordered spring role(Shrimp and pork),it came in 1 pc cut in 2 halves,one side of the roll had meat (seasoned),the other side ,simply boiled,no seasoning whatsoever.The peanut sauce that came with it tasted like peanut butter !  b)Husband ordered shaken beef,it was good but too small for the price.  c)I ordered Chicken soup,the meat were very chewy,felt under cooked.Very uncomfortable to eat.Broth missed the flavors .The server didnt come even once to check if the food was OK.I didnt want to waste food I could just eat the noodles and the sprouts.  d)Server came to ask if its time to pay the check.When we mentioned him how the chicken was he took the bowl to show in kitchen.He returned with the check saying nothing back!   If you looking for authentic vietnamese meal,this is not the right place! And Btw the waiter never heard of "Boba Tea",right !!!Thanks but no thanks,not going there ever again.

cqLF42IuO4U6hGllMhzQqQ.text: What great cozy little place! The owner actually serves there and is perfect in every way. The surf and turf Phoo is incredible, the owner brought several wines to sample before choosing. The food is clean and natural and delicious.

nZZdVXsW8WoiAjRy5OdOfg.text: I love this place! The owners Ty and Hue are a blast and treat you like family. The bartender, Xenia,  is delightful. You must try the special of grandma's grape leaf wrapped tenderloin! The spring rolls are super fresh and delicious. I've never had anything I didn't like here. It's always a great time at Slanted!

SSgAPrwsgRTkFWj0kYBkLg.text: Really good food and nice service. Had a beer shrimp spring roll and another Shrimp dish I don't remember it's name.  All was really fresh and unique.  You should go and give it a try. Look like a nice place for romantic dinner as well the cocktails looked good.

T7t8YUuHCSMK6x2UAB2Hmg.text: We stumbled upon Slanted Rice because everywhere else was closed on Sunday! And we're so glad we did. I didn't care much for the egg rolls (they didn't have veggies on the side just lettuce and mint) but the flavor was still great!! Our server was awesome- friendly but not over the top and even when they were out of the wine we wanted she totally compensated and gave us another glass of something else. Overall great service GREAT pho, and super yummy freshness! 5 stars.

FbEkojogl9ECpTMoziFltw.text: Love this place's, food, feeling and service. Treated like family. Fun atmosphere!  By far, best wings in town!!!!!!  If you love crispy sweet wings, this is the place. Highly recommend Slanted Rice.

kbo3LC4uMFJ0P4EoDqd87Q.text: Slanted Rice appeals to all my restaurant wants: it's owner operated, cozy, & the food is homey and delicious with satisfying yet healthy-ish options. Our favorites: chicken pho and the clay pot crispy rice beef. The Brussels sprouts appetizer is hands-down the best sprouts dish I've ever had! We get take out more often than we eat in, because this is my go-to take out place.

wnpbp1slU1mDLcVU11ywzA.text: Excellent service with authentic Vietnamese cuisine. We felt so welcomed as soon as we entered the restaurant. A hidden gem, don't tell anyone!

GfJBu7McPPXBo1VjoEmFHA.text: AMAZING!!!! The firecracker shrimp and garlic noodles changed my life !!! The sangria was so refreshing and tasty .... I wish I would have found this place sooner. Everyone was so nice and the good was very fresh and delicious .

cfW4b685IHFbhJYSiKdfSQ.text: I moved out od the neighborhood  and one of the restaurants  i really miss is this one......best soups ever.

MglhXUI9ZKPT_gZpC1UZOA.text: If you are looking for a healthy Pho this is the place.  Great place for hot pot dishes!

wV2FCvWDbX-n48MIOkKxyw.text: A Coworker brought me here for my birthday and I couldn't be more impressed.  After checking the reviews I gave the Firecracker Shrimp and Garlic Noodles a try and oh my goodness.  I do not even know where to begin.  The broth and salad that came first were delicious.  The shrimp was amazing and the noodles were out of this world.  Because it was my birthday we also got some of their chocolate mousse which was a HUGE win.  It tasted amazing.  I will be returning and soon.

3CF2HDsptgzUalSat6Q0nA.text: Holy Cow this place is nothing short of amazing, the employees are fantastic but food is mind blowing! Owners are there all the time and really care, they are friendly, personable. This place is perfect for romance, a night out, whatever...I LOVE this place!!!!

nh4fO_S98XsX6iJBFPqpgw.text: If you enjoy overpriced, mediocre Vietnamese food, all while the owners are secretly insulting you from 10 feet away, this place is for you!   First the food, which I give 3 stars: We got the pork spring rolls, which were okay but could have used more flavor. I got the vegetarian pho, which was decent, and my girlfriend got the combination pho. Her dish was pretty flavorless, and the meat didn't seem very fresh.  And now for the owners, which I give 0 stars. To our face they were extremely kind and welcoming. Had I been there on my own I would have walked out with a great vibe. But, my girlfriend happens to be fluent in Mandarin and Cantonese, and apparently the owners were too dumb to realize that an Asian customer might be able to speak their language. They were standing behind the bar, 5 feet away from us, and spent most of their time talking about the customers. They made multiple rude comments about the interracial couples in the restaurant, including some about the family sitting next to us. I won't go into other details, but let's just say I was pretty angry after hearing them.   (EDIT: While there I clearly heard a guy behind the bar telling another customer that he was from Shanghai, so I find it hard to believe that nobody there speaks Mandarin.)  There are better Vietnamese restaurants in Scottsdale...do yourself a favor and avoid these guys.

uyF5kzCYK2yWcejdsT4Z_Q.text: Slanted Rice is locally owned by a husband and wife duo. The owners are so down to earth, make sure to take the time check on their customer's experience, and will even serve if short! Their food is on point. The garlic butter edamame, pho, and sizzling steak dish is to die for. There is also a shrimp and noodle dish I've seen that I'm dying to try on the next visit. The food is GREAT! We always enjoy our dinner/evening thoroughly when we visit. Good job Slanted Rice!

MWbA_PLFb62sTMKZ4PQtkw.text: Outstanding food and amazing staff   This is such a fun place that is always great.   It's a small very friendly place

kdVyfj3G63PYRavRVRiXUA.text: Shrimp Crispy Rice CLAY POT is all I can say! Holy moly this was FABULOUS.

eJa5Bg0j9iG66lMxgvSKPA.text: Pho soups are the best in Scottsdale with exceptional service and pleasant atmosphere

ZOwiwVb1OlULBnsp-rhikg.text: Delicious new Vietnamese restaurant! More upscale than most but still just as tasty as the mom and pop shops. We started with the pork egg rolls which were really big and very good. Pho appetizer is a perfect size if your not too hungry and really cheap on happy hour ($3). Atmosphere and service were awesome. Definitely a small dining area so it's probably crazy busy during lunch and dinner hours. I recommend going at happy hour so you can get in!

Q8WnzPH_E_fK4rr25b6kPw.text: Looking for a gluten free restaurant & craving pho, decided to Slanted Rice, got there; kind of busy, had to wait for a table. Got seated and looked over the menu; they had (*gf) symbols, so made us feel at ease. Pho entree didn't list as *gf so had to ask. Ordered spring rolls; they brought out gluten free sauces, very good. Enjoyed Pho wish had more non broken bean sprouts, very accommodating once crowd slowed down; also very tight quarters. Enjoyed our time there will be back!

BSXPXMENuo3MFw2AqRpaZg.text: Had dinner twice here.  Food was very good!  Authentic with a slight twist of western flare. Egg rolls are very standard and good.  Clay pots are our favorite!  I had pho both times, thought the broth was too thin, not enough flavor.  I will not come here for pho, but will try other items.  Service was very good and friendly.  Great place for neighrbood eats for Scottsdale, a town that lacks of taste buds and variety.

KY4wUeehLoLZPtTS7TWSnA.text: The Pho Ga was great. The ambience is classy. The service could have been better but overall, solid Pho experience. Good spot for a date.

FFwP7-nq205efgUA_pF7ow.text: Lots of vegan options, which made me very happy. The pho was super yummy and flavorful, and the spring rolls were fresh and delicious. We came with a small dog and they were very accommodating, even bringing out a bowl of water for him. The patio was lovely. Service was great!

kFI7vvHrzM3z9bLVRJzsdQ.text: Delicious food!  We got the chicken and rice noodles, combo pho, and egg rolls.  So yummy and it was ready for pick up 15 minutes from when I called.

0QuCGro60We545VDueJ_RA.text: New to Phoenix, rainy day and looking for great Pho!  It was fantastic, as was the salt and pepper calamari.  Will be back :)

WQjwTs6uAe70RMIp5zuXVQ.text: Instantly attracted to the restaurant. Modern, clean and GREAT FOOD. The environment is very welcome and the staff is very personable and extremely attentive and caring. I highly recommend this place

dfei0IMKSCITFqEOM37Wew.text: Been here a couple times...great to sit outdoors and people watch. Had the chicken lemongrass rice plate for lunch, and for dinner the Filet Mignon Shaken Beef. Great presentation of the food, high quality and very tasty..lots of flavor.  Nice ambiance.

gpFnoknnh22a_lvjhlJdfg.text: Fire shrimp and shaken beef are fantastic  The staff was very helpful cool bar to sit eat and watch a game

XGd7_Qu3zakR5orOd5WgoA.text: I was surprised to find a Vietnamese option while visiting Phoenix, but I was pleasantly surprised.   Sllanted Rice is a fairly intimate place, but comfortable. I found the service was good too. Like many others I tried the Crispy rice in Clay pot with Chicken. Wow! It was very hot, almost too hot. The rice reminded of Persian rice or burnt rice in a good Paella. Once I the dish cooled down enough to eat I really enjoyed the bok choy, the shitake mushrooms and the sauce. The chicken was kind of plain, but that could be my fault. I bet the veggie version is worth trying.   The price was right too.

mbwifmSanwUkhNGIYpRjLg.text: Amazing place with very good food. Pho soup is phenomenal! The place is clean and i love it!

d6v9UmfvxPRf4PKfQSHwWg.text: This place is about as Vietnamese as I am. If you're looking for authentic pho, look elsewhere! They use a tepid, thin, flavorless vegetarian "broth" for the base of their pho. Their fried chicken app was lower quality than fast food. Service was poor as well. Even after we reminded them that we didn't get our soup and salad before the main entree, they still brought it out with the main dish. The waitress seemed put off by my questions about the food before I ordered, not knowledgable and proud of what they make. The assistant food runners slammed dishes down in front of us hastily and practically ran away, which was odd because they weren't particularly busy. And is it just me, or does the name of this place sound racist?

MchTpJCS7pVOVlbdFSuHDw.text: I don't live very close to Slanted Rice but I always stop in when in the area.  The food is delicious and I am always greeted with a smile and glad to see you back.  I had some Czech friends visiting and they had never had Vietnamese food before and they loved it.  The owners family have several restaurants in the Valley and they truly know what they are doing.  My friend was suffering from a cold and I said get the Chicken Pho, I had the Slanted Hanoi, and my other friend had the Shaken Beef.  It is now their favorite restaurant.  People that have never tried Vietnamese food will find it to be their favorite as well.

jQa46KzoHMlV3Lipx74yLg.text: The ambience here is relaxing. Their spring rolls are amazing and unique. Their wings and salt and pepper shrimp are also good. My favorite part is their Pho, which have the best broth and meet. Service could be better but the food is completely worth it. My favorite place for Vietnamese food.

T_nud1-ayn7M8UxfA4gsJw.text: Great quality with top-notch, fresh ingredients. Their pho is amazing! And their version of Bun Bo was the best I've had anywhere, thanks to the sirloin beef and jicama it came with. I'm a take out kind of gal, and I totally appreciate that they don't skimp on to-go orders.

R5YdUSIt1_D-ENNOolRDfw.text: Went there for the first time to meet friends who go there often.  Followed the advice of other Yelp reviewers to have the chicken/rice hotpot - very good. Among the appetizers that we ordered the roasted brussel sprouts was the biggest hit.  The shrimp with lemongrass was also very tasty.  Wine list is good and not overpriced.  Good craft beer on tap as well. Quite a lot of salt in Vietnamese cuisine, so drink lots of water.  Restaurant is not too noisy. Service is good.  A nice neighborhood restaurant.

T1EEkuKdl8ISnE7HABaG8g.text: Family owned and great food, whether you like Pho or Bun you really can't go wrong with any selection you make.  Ice eaten here at least a dozen times and have never been disappointed!

NNNuIadQs-vHqgb0Tf7O8Q.text: My husband and I just tried this for the first time, staff was very friendly, service was great and the food was awesome! I had the pho, super good, my husband had the clay pot which he loved. We will definitely be back!

BdxVSENeY1ILG9340rWLaw.text: Very tasty, very fresh.  I was quite surprised as I don't think much of Asian food in Phoenix, but this was good.  A little pricey for lunch I thought, but the quality of the food and service made up for it.

rs-ZmFiWQetm6OVEayu57A.text: This is my favorite restaurant and we drive 20 minutes to get there.  My husband likes spicy but I can't do it and they have options for both. The sweet chicken curry is amazing!! All the dishes are great. My husband loves the spicy sauces available. We bring friends frequently or we sit at the bar once in a while and watch a football game and I pick up to go when I'm in the area.  Always great. Staff (including owner) friendly. Food comes out in timely manner.  Good wine options.

9acN23KkYYRV1yhU5gOrQw.text: This place has the worst service ever. I go to hole in the wall places that have way better everything. I wouldn't come back.

wTU9rjgU7pgWtk5WMjjm4w.text: Very, very good food. Service is laid back and they are a little quiet for a Friday night.  The Edamame was excellent. We ordered a second of it because it was so good. My hubby got the pho but I  opted for the crispy rice which was delicious.

Dp_FM3lKZRFeDFviVJBLTQ.text: Hands down my most favorite Vietnamese restaurant. I measure Vietnamese eateries by their Bun because that's what I order most often. The Bun here seems to have the most vegetables and meat anywhere. Atmosphere is always great, outside patio is very nice for dinner. Would give more stars if I could.

zNCthVQUJ_VWxCmGryeLsQ.text: I give the Pho (veggie) 5 stars because it's so good. The bad part is that is appears it has become managed by imbeciles. No one even looks at you when you walk in and sit at the bar. If the place is 75% full the servers are running around like they don't know what's happening. You call ahead and the phone is busy all the time, usually it's in somebody's back pocket, or they put you on hold and just put the phone down and forget. Food is great, but the service has gotten really bad.

GU-Jr_eOX-XK70vQ4__BMA.text: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! I can't say enough about this locally owned restaurant. The food is amazing....from the Ginger chicken, garlic noodles, or even Brussels sprouts this place creates it all to perfection. But don't only expect great food. Be prepared to expect an excellent atmosphere and the best service. The owners personable and know how to run a great establishment with delicious food and great customer service.

wFuH3cg_BLyB7Kg0bDF-VQ.text: WOW WOW WOW! So I've been meaning to try Slanted Rice for some time as friends had recommended it. I was in the area this afternoon and got a chance to try this gem! Excellent wait staff, friendly and inviting. The food was exceptional. Fresh authentic and aromatic. Portion sizes were perfect! I recommend the chicken wings, spring roll (shrimp), grilled shrimp and vermicelli and the Pho was to die for! I will be back!!

u6Jr4TEXPYYHK45Pt5-UyA.text: Tastes soooo good! The Thai tea was delicious and I had the crispy rice clay pot steak for lunch which was wonderful. My husband enjoyed his lunch too, but for whatever reason it went right through both of us even though we had different dishes. I wouldn't come back for that reason.

JRLQY91fcLqE5GbijI7w5Q.text: I've never been such a slow vietnamese restaurant. There was only one team ahead but we were waiting for 40 minutes. Eventhough there were three empty tables but no one cleaned up. And it took more than 10 minutes to get menu. I couldn't imagine when I can get the food served. So We just left without order. Will not recommend to my friends.

DSaeQHO9VVvCE2Vxi-18gQ.text: Took my family visiting for the holidays here. They had seen the restaurant on Triple D with Guy. Service was phenomenal and food was superb. Thank you! They were very pleased. Everything was super fresh.

xAKjHJ4uqARAa6Vq3qhW7w.text: That was the worst experience I've had in years. I tried giving zero stars but couldn't. It was all because of the server and it wasn't just my table. Everyone was pulling their hair out. Sucks when bad service ruins a whole restaurant. The server was just clueless. I served tables for years and this woman had no idea. I'd rather be kicked in the dick than eat there again.

EXjhd6dm6hZRjEpkj2mnLQ.text: I didn't know this place was on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives..so I was excited to see Guy Fieri's face spray painted on the wall with his signature when I walked in. I was promptly seated and given water right away. Overall - the service was awesome.   With the lunch special, you get a soup and salad. The main course I got lemongrass chicken and a side of garlic noodles. The chicken was....horrible. It wasn't cooked all the way through or cooked correctly and had that chewy nasty texture in your mouth. I barely touched the chicken. The garlic noodles, on the other hand, were fire! They also hooked me up with a good "grandma's spicy chili oil" which was really good on the noodles.  I would give this place a second chance because of the service and the ambience...but I would stick to ordering vegetarian food. That chicken was absolutely disgusting.

REv753uUWCaws7o9NBvw0w.text: I was pleasantly surprised at how authentic the food taste. The steak Pho, Shishito Peppers and Crispy Rice in a Clay Pot with beef were all a hit! The Vietnamese iced coffee was the perfect ending to this great meal!

R89CE4czeDY9whyZ3NrWeA.text: I have been going to this restaurant over the last few years. Food is good, however service is lacking.  On the last visit (literally), as I will NEVER step foot in this place again, the waiter (who happened to be the owner), incorrectly placed my order, when I questioned him about it he was very defensive and stated he was the "owner" and suggested that next time I order to please review the menu first. This guy is arrogant and can't admit he made a mistake. Would much rather spend my money in other establishments around the area such as Humble Pie, Houstons, Totties, etc....Where the food and the service is good.

tS5e9eWgF4k6-qHRbaBX1g.text: Very good! I had the chicken pho which was phenomenal and packed with flavor. I was able to take most of it home cause it was such a big portion and the leftovers were great too. We also had the spring rolls, love the peanut sauce!! However, I did try the vegetable rolls and the chicken teriyaki (both featured on GGG) and I didn't see the hype... good but nothing special.

Yj2zo0CS_eXbLus4Lclhiw.text: Such great service and the food was amazing! I first ate here with my girlfriend after hearing about it on Diners Drive Ins and Dives (conveniently, when we were having a staycay in Scottsdale and had watched the show in our hotel room). We loved everything that we ate and can't wait to go back to try more items on the menu.

dpZpvP5yJNxPaGZpxtebNg.text: This is an excellent place to get authentic PHO. They have a full bar too with very friendly staff. On the wall too is a signed picture by the Guy Fieri(or however you spell his name). Which I think his shows DDDs arrived there but I couldn't find the episode. Anyways great place with a great selection.

jXlA9fPWDv64x_xnWEQXdg.text: It seems like the food that are served here give some people stomach problems.  Human waste matters were floating inside the toilet of women's restroom, possibly due to the food consumed at the establishment.   I had an upset stomach too after having pho noodle soup.  Despite the fancy interior of the restaurant, it makes you wonder if the employees wash their food properly and if they even wash their hands well.  After suffering from stomach ache, it would be difficult to  give this place another visit.

kwVUTOqCqzMuQmaNwCJQHw.text: Heard nothing but good things about Slanted Rice. We finally went tonight for the Pho Noodles. I was really looking forward to it.  Broth tasted like soap. Chicken must have been microwaved. It was so hard and tough I couldn't chew it!! My husband got the Meatball Pho. Tough again! Do they microwave their meat? How can white chicken and a meatball be hard and tough? We DO NOT recommend and will not return.

clx40Y3a0-5q0V6MS0lO6Q.text: We went to Slanted Rice a couple of weeks ago and had a very, very aggravating experience. One of us is a diagnosed Celiac and must eat gluten-free. A young lady (server) explains that a particular appetizer is GF because they use a separate, gluten-free fryer (and we explain all of the general concerns about gluten and cross-contamination).  We order the appetizer, thinking it would be safe. When the appetizer arrives, we ask again of another server to ensure it's GF, but this time, the fellow we speak to at the front says, "no no, there is no gluten-free fryer, so you would have cross-contamination."  Of course, this causes us great alarm and we're up walking around the place trying to find the young lady and anyone else who will talk to us, to assess whether Slanted Rice really understands Celiac disease, or if their GF claim is not a serious one. Then we ask whether the pho is also GF because we ordered that and we are now in a serious predicament because the Celiac has also taken insulin (because of diabetes) so it is urgent that we eat immediately (don't want a blood glucose emergency). There is general chaos and then the fellow from the front, sensing that we are angry, alarmed, and pretty ticked off, starts to say that we shouldn't be eating out if we're so sensitive to gluten, the words he used were, "Well, gee, if you're so sensitive to ... " and we glared at him and he stopped talking, but the message that he was about to convey was obvious. On top of that, he was arrogant and insulting and I wanted to eject him from the restaurant. So, there is clearly a major, major disconnect at Slanted Rice and the staff do NOT know much about gluten-free food prep or Celiac from allergies to nuts, pollen, or anything else. A horrible experience all around. If you are Celiac and want to avoid a problem, avoid Slanted Rice.

u2SsIUt_MCidu_LxRLgUvg.text: I had never been here prior to today. I walk in and not only am I greeted immediately, but also with such kindness. The restaurant was very clean and the waitress was probably the sweetest waitress I have ever had in my life. So I thought, ok well the service is impeccable and the restaurant is very clean the food might not be that great, but it most definitely was delicious. They were fast, efficient, clean, hospitable and just an all-around perfect dining experience.  Thank you Slanted Rice, I will definitely be coming back.

vMKFQ8gWzwaP-xCYxfmQ-A.text: Just great. If you have a craving for Vietnamese good this is a great to try or go again on a regular basis and explore the menu. Everything is good. They have a nice veggie pho. There can be a wait at times but staff was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8ototP10le2kgHy40HLWag.text: This is a gem in Scottsdale - I used to have to go to south Scottsdale or Tempe to even find decent Vietnamese food and i'm so happy this place is just down the road from my place!  Also a huge plus - they are open on SUNDAY! There is nothing better than a big bowl of Pho on a Sunday.  The broth is rich in flavor.  At lunch you get a small bowl of just the broth and its such a little treat.  My favorites:  Dragon Lady Spring rolls Garlic noodles with Shrimp Rice Vermicelli with Shrimp Chicken or Beef Pho  Enjoy!

qYyblJjo-bggbpEuGDqepQ.text: Great lunch spot. Pho is my go to dish. Portions are huge! Staff is friendly and quick. I get it to go as well and they do a nice job so the broth doesn't spill by the time I get home.

AZMQDTuAKdBrIIPImishXw.text: This Americanized Vietnamese joint will make dew if you need a quick pho fix. The lemongrass Brussels sprouts are a highlight on the appetizer menu and are packed full of flavor. The pho here is relatively good but you are limited in options. Like all pho places, the servings are colossal in size. Unfortunately the menu is in English and it takes away from the authentic feel of many other Vietnamese restaurants.

Kkzwjta2lKjZTdWD1XhZbA.text: Not good all frozen heated and not fresh. You can do better at home or Panda for Asian food.

jxU6kmPLMVlYFdqs-Ue4tg.text: I picked up pho from here when I was feeling sick! The ambience here is cute! It's a little nicer than most of the pho places here and it looks like the bar was well stocked. The bartender was very friendly.   The pho was good enough for me to come back. Not the BEST I've had in my life but it will do for Scottsdale!

3yl0mSqRW4BDRtNrcWm5aw.text: Fox News and the Golf channel to compliment my lunch? Appreciate the constant reminder I was in the great red state of Arizona. With that being said, service and food were just ok. Noodles were a bit overcooked...

4SowBA97LuDSyyawleiR6g.text: My family and I had a reservation for 8:30, and we came in a half hour early, seeing if we could be seated then, however we were willing to wait until our actual reservation time. The host seemed very annoyed and acted like he could barely find a table for us. The host turned out to be our waiter Julien (he never introduced himself so we had to ask the bus boy for his name.) He was very unfriendly and acted like we were a nuisance, he would come up to the table and wait for us to say something, didn't explain the menu or any of the sauces he would put on the table (it was our first time here). An elderly couple walked in and did not have reservations, he told them he could not seat them even though there were three open tables, and made them sit at the bar. No one else came and sat at those tables. The waiter made the experience less enjoyable. The food was good and the bus boy was very polite and cute, however I would not go back due to the poor service by our waiter.

BOhD5K0PighRM6ZRX1urLQ.text: The food here is terrible. I even had a pebble in my spring roll. They apologized and said they won't charge me for it! Really? If you had Vietnamese food before you will be highly dissapointed.

2U1UStZIGhXMapPdC-m0fg.text: Food was GREAT. Pho was a perfect way to end a rainy day in the valley. Only complaint was the service. The staff was extremely friendly but it just seemed pretty slow to get food.   I did have an issue with my reservation though. I called ahead to make a reservation for two and was told that the earliest I could get it would be 8PM. I showed up at 7:10 b/c I was in the area and was hoping if something else came up I could get in early.. At around 7:25, two other people walked in and said they didn't have a reservation. The hostess came up to me and asked if I wanted to take the two spots at the bar or let the other couple have it and keep waiting. I was starving so I took the two spots at the bar, and the couple that didn't have a reservation was given a table for two before I could order my drink.. Made me wonder why I even had to make a reservation in the first place.

8sWjdDjVIpV6F3bKGNY6gQ.text: Amazing tender juicy shaken beef for only $16 lunch including broth and salad! Dinner portion is $22 way less expensive then American Steak houses. Managers trick is to serve a lime with salt and pepper which enhances the already delicious juicy flavors. I loved the broth and salad dressing a lot too. Hue (pronounced hway) the manager is adorable due to her outgoing friendly bubbly nature and obvious passion for the food they serve. I am visiting from San Diego and bookmarked this lovely Bistro for any future travels to Scottsdale. My husband ordered the pork plate which was also very flavorful. Interior is modern hip. Happy Hour from 1-6pm!

WPSzTkpyXebGZ0p36N6ahw.text: Not really sure what issue is here. I see a lot of reviews that complain about service but tonight everyone was very friendly. They were busy, so they were working, but were helpful and attentive.

29VTk-M1dbsfRE-qJMGdXg.text: Chloe is amazing. She has only been working here for about two weeks, and is all over the place. Knows the menu very well, and works behind the bar.  The pho was actually really good, spices are available right in front of you.  Little overpriced for cocktails and drinks, but the phone was reasonably priced, especially considering the amount you receive.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar in the back

53d65YoRWG4yNspTTS9p9w.text: The service was super slow on a Saturday night because there was only 1 server. All in all I found some of the food we ordered a complete rip off, and the rest wasn't good enough to make me give an overall positive review.  The spring rolls (pork and shrimp) were $4 per roll. The rolls weren't large, nor were they so special they should be $4. Usually I expect to get 2 rolls for the same price.   We order the pho (beef) appetizer. I didn't eat it, but my friend said the broth was bland. They weren't impressed (we're from LA, I realize we're probably spoiled by great pho). My friend also ordered the vegetarian pho but didn't seem too impressed.   The one star of the night was the firecracker shrimp and garlic noodles. I have to admit, when they brought it out it didn't look very appetizing, but it really was tasty. I'd order it again.   Don't order the spring rolls -- order the firecracker shrimp. Expect a long dinner.  I paid $15 for my share of half an entree and the solitary spring roll.

gDLe6gjqBxdaG7GHO9i6NQ.text: Favorite Vietnamese restaurant in the East Valley! My co-workers and i all frequent this place at least once a week for lunch (sometimes I go twice in the same week). There honestly isn't one thing on the menu I would advise against, everything is tasty!  The Pork Bang Mi is killer, some people say a little heavy on the jalapenos, but the spicy kick is more than welcome with the sweet pork and cilantro.  But their Shaken Beef is the real deal. Simmered steak comes out sizzling like fajitas with onions, a side of white rice,  and a small dish of salt and pepper with lime. Guaranteed to fill you up and leave you satisfied. The place is a bit small, so wait times can be rough at the lunch hour, but the staff is friendly and the service is excellent.

qhG40haZeHNRGXftC9F-aQ.text: Great Vietnamese cuisine in the devils playground ? You ask? PHO shizzle! I was very surprised by Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro a couple of weeks ago when a group of friends all landed from our various business trips for that particular week and met up for our monthly dinner outing to catch up with each other like we do someplace we haven't tried for drinks and of course , food!  Having grown up near the Bay Area, I know pho , PHO sho! , AND, have yet to really, REALLY, be blown away by any of the Vietnamese places here in the valley.  Slanted Rice is housed in the Hilton Village ; It's trendy ; chic and when you step inside, the vibe is cool; the mixology of drinks don't disappoint either. In fact, my Knees Bees Martini , a lovely libation of lavender honey gin, honey simple syrup, Yuzu, lemon and a smidgen of pomegranate will get you slanted , if your not mindful of your sips! It was stirred perfectly : not too sweet and not too tart and what I needed to end my week with. They have sake on tap; several brews, including Ichiban and Sapporo and a great, different drink menu with unique cocktails, as well as the usual beer and wines by the pint or glass.  Upon ordering our starters, we shared the Tom, (shrimp), Spring Rolls served with peanut sauce. It was a generous serving and I could seriously see myself grabbing an order to go for a later lunch since I love Vietnamese spring rolls so much. I loved that the waitress brought a selection of ramekins of sauces also for the dishes we ordered, as I like chile sauce on my rolls for some kick. The Slanted Pho is a great starter too, in fact, if you're like me and find the pho is always SO much to eat! , this is the perfect amount of Pho for the smaller eater: make it your main meal! A smaller bowl of the entree version.  My dinner entree was the Crispy Rice in a Clay Pot , (Com Tay Cam), with Shrimp. So unique! The entree comes out in a , ( you guessed it!), hot cast iron clay pot . VERY hot, in fact, to give the rice the crispness. The rice at bottom is topped with shiitake mushrooms , bok choy and the shrimp , (or the meat , seafood or veggie of your choice ), and this perfect amount of flavorful sauce. I don't think I would order this particular entree as a take out option, however, as the rice would, (as my leftovers did ), lose their crispy texture. My boyfriend , ( who became my fiancee on this night!) , ordered the entree Pho. Holy bowls! Maximum pho! This is one large bowl of Pho served ! He can never decide on one item so he got the combination of steak , meatballs , tenderloin, and flank steak. Loaded with broth and noodles and lots of meats .. and yes. He over ordered. Go figure. The Shaken Beef, ( Com Bo Luc Lac ),  is also a entree I'll try again. Tender, tender filet mignon served on a hot cast iron rectangular plate of sizzling onions and a side of freshly steamed rice. The Prawns with Garlic Noodles , ( Tom Nuong Va Mi Toi), was another favorite; a lot of large, nice prawns housed in these amazingly, garlic'd noodles. MMMMM.  All of our dinner entrees came with a bowl of scallion broth and small green salad with a miso ginger dressing. Needless to say, you won't leave Slanted Rice Bistro hankering for more. You will leave with leftovers if you were like us and over ordered to sample a bunch of different things.  I left this dinner outing, with a new blingy diamond on my left hand! The staff here was all in on it, ( as were our friends) and made the night fun and very special. IF I were to change anything , I would recommend later hours, particularly on weekends; this place has all the elements of a great bar so why not capitalize on that? 900pm closure on a Friday is just a tad odd to me .... But really, the food, unique menu and great bar and ambience give Slanted Rice a perfect 5 ...

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crispy Rice in Clay Pot with Shrimp ( seriously this was worth two meals for me!)

MJDqb6XGlk2Yfqs3LtQq5Q.text: We ate dinner here yesterday and were very happy with the experience. We ordered the chicken rice pot and the tenderloin pot. Both were really good and I didn't leave a single spec of food in the bowl. The rice that is at the bottom of the bowl was burnt and stuck to the bottom but this turned out to be an amazing positive, not negative. The burnt rice was super crispy and flavorful, not what you would have expected at all, so amazing! Also, we ordered the salt and pepper shrimp as an appetizer, excellent. The onions and jalapenos served with it were excellent as well.  Our waitress was very pleasant and provided excellent service. Make sure you get here early in the evening because the restaurant is very small and seating will be difficult. The only negative thing that I can say is they don't have high chairs for young kids. I have two children three and under, which this made things a little difficult.  Overall excellent food and service, definitely recommend it!

aSMzuSaa_vRStCNXF2awZQ.text: I am from Houston, TX and we have pho restaurants on every corner. I eat Pho at least every other week and I can make pho as well. So my family and I got there my and ordered Pho the waitress informed us that the broth is vegan, maybe it's a Scottsdale thing. The pho was pretty good being that its vegan and the vegetables (bean sprout and basal were not fresh at all, looked dead) and there were very stingy about it too, but I have had better pho and the price was too expensive $13.00 a bowl and in Houston a large pho is $7.00.

TKmF8qSSEqRT3zlMy3-i-A.text: I highly recommend the Crispy rice clay pot.  I will return here many more times!!!  The spring rolls were also great.    Best Asian food I have found in the Phoenix metro area.

XNRbV9VacBOg2YxrYvsh3Q.text: As lovers of good pho we have been trying to find a go-to restaurant in Scottsdale for a while now and Slanted Rice just became it. This review comes after three different visits and the food was on point each time. The restaurant is on the smaller side but has a cool atmosphere and on a nice night you can sit on the patio and enjoy. The wait staff is super nice and never minds accommodating a three year old with a healthy pho addiction as well!   The pho is the star of the show for us and their broth has the richness that only comes with a long preparation. One thing I really love about SR is that they also have a smaller portion pho on the appetizer menu! This gives you the opportunity to enjoy the soup and try one of the other many delicious menu items. So far we have tried the chicken salad with peanut dressing- great, the spring rolls- great, and the clay pot rice- great!   As you can tell there is a theme here of delicious food, top it off with a Vietnamese coffee or a cocktail from the bar and you wont regret it.

1PeVDGkJhDbkr8pJhtzjPQ.text: The fragrance coming from the restaurant was amazing. I was waking to Humble Pie and smelled Vietnamese food, specifically pho. I didn't realize they are neighbors to humble pie. I didn't want to try this place because I saw the prices and it was higher than what I was used to paying for authentic Vietnamese food. But then, we ARE in Scottsdale and we are paying for the service and ambience.   I ordered beef pho. I always taste the broth first before adding condiments. I like my broth clean. I guess it can't be too clean because of the beef. The noodles seemed over cooked. But when I added Sriracha, mint, bean sprouts, cilantro, jalapeno peppers, and lime...it all came together. I was enjoyed the pho, surprisingly. I didn't expect too much because of the restaurant being in Scottsdale. But I'll definitely come back. The have happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pho tai

NFcnVnG6Z6ctEBqrFgypsw.text: Such a good restaurant! We go there about once a week and am always pleased. The beef salad is my go-to dish and absolutely delicious!!! In addition, the waitstaff is great. Cannot recommend this place enough.

ixrzZ6AJJ3jOpvhZz_846A.text: Place sucks.   I've now come here enough to pick our what is consistent.  If you eat here you will encounter some or all of these :  1.  Wait to be seated by somebody that is neglecting a table somewhere  2. Be seated in a booth oddly close to someone when other more open seats are available.   3.  Be seated and then sit for a while before a server comes by.    4.  Finally get to order.   5.  Not get what you ordered.   6.  Have your drink sit empty for most of your meal.   7.  Have your food get cold as your friends misorder is being cooked.   8. Eat tasty food when you do get it.   9.  Not have any silverware.   10.  Be confused about the music they play. It's like they want it to be a club.   11. Over pay.   12. Come badk because there's no other place nearby.

1FF_CpJqMvLAJXIomleMLQ.text: When we arrived we were asked how long we would be - good grief what a greeting!  They supposedly had a lot of reservations for later and were trying to plan.  We thought it was rude since we go there quite often.   They also had the AC on and it was 60 degrees and chilly outside so we moved to another table and had a girl wait on us.  She did okay but never cleared our plates - not after the appetizer or the dinner, or when she brought the ticket, we just kept stacking them up at the end of the table.  Or when she picked up the check or when she collected it - good grief again - poor service all around - this is basic waiting - clear off dirty plates before you leave the bill.   I did not feel like doing her job or reminding her what to do.  We felt we were treated poorly.  I also had to ask for a water refill - which is also amazing - we left knowing we had good food - love the shrimp soup and the spring rolls - I guess that makes up for the bad service.  We do like to eat there.

nggnA5cR_OAqttceSkdOTw.text: My Slanted Rice Review  The other day a friend who was sick asked if I could pick up some Pho, suggested Slanted Rice since it was recommended by someone I met months back who said it was best Pho restaurant he had tried locally.  Being that my friend and I came from Seattle, we were used to some very good Pho restaurants and quickly found that the local ones here in PHX/Scottsdale were far from the same level.  So here is my recent experience with Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro.  Upon arriving, I was greeted by 3 different employees over a 5 minute period. I explained to each one that I simply wanted to place an order to go, only the third employee told me to have a seat at the bar where I could place my order.  After sitting at the bar, the bartender moved some items out of the way and greeted me.  Two other patrons then came in and sat next to me who she greeted and started conversing with as well as provided them with menus ...... something I was not offered immediately.  After another 5 minutes she finally asked what I needed and when I said I wanted to place an order to go she started to offer me a menu, but I told her I knew what I wanted.  At that point, she started to talk with the other patrons again for another 5 minutes or so before turning back to me to ask what I wanted to order!!  So now that my order was placed, I focused on some taking care of some emails and other work while I waited. During this time, apparently my order was brought out in a bag ready to go, but was placed on the back counter near the other 2 patrons where it sat for over 10 minutes.  Having noticed that the other patrons who ordered after me received their food, I attempted to get the bartenders attention which took over another 5 minutes since she kept walking away from the bar area.  Once she finally came back, I asked if the bag was my order which it turns out it was .... and had been sitting on the counter for close to 15+ minutes at this point.  Now, I take my card out to pay and she tells me to wait for the waitress to come since she has to process the payment because food is on a different system.  At this point, the majority of other patrons have left while only a few people are sitting at the bar or some of the tables ..... yet the waitress seems unable to come to the bar to take care of my payment even though other people around me have paid for their meals.  I begin to tap my card on the counter in annoyance for another 10 minutes or more before the bartender finally goes to the waitress and asks her to take care of my order which she reluctantly does.  At this point, I am more annoyed by the fact that no one bother to recognize or apologize for the delays or even offered to discount my order now that it has gone cold with all of the waiting (over 30 minutes!).  I am not sure if this is how they handle their business all of the time or if it was just that day, but as someone who dines out regularly especially with all of the traveling I do, I found their customer service left a lot to be desired.  For stars, I am giving 2 rather than 1 since my friend said the Pho was really good and better than anything she has had since moving to AZ.  Am I open to giving Slanted Rice another try to show that this was a fluke? Not sure since I am really keen on the level of service and not just how good the food is.

NJM-jxbiQ6IgY5cBnDu8xg.text: The food was ok. We were recommended to this place by friends who order to-go often. We had vegetable egg rolls that had little flavor and were super mushy, so I didn't eat more than 1 bite. We also ordered Pho which wasn't bad, but wasn't great either, thankfully I got a side order which was the size of a coffee cup- I'm not sure that I'd go back, since there are really great Vietnamese choices in the same vicinity of Slanted Rice, one I believe is across the street.

8POyrMmlD46p3TFRY57ixw.text: Total heaven! I go here often to order their pho and spring rolls. Super fresh with a lot of flavor and large portions.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pho with spring rolls.

c5KfdNnODej08g55NtYFuQ.text: Love the food. Hate the service. Been coming here for over a year now.  Last night was the last straw. On our penultimate visit. We were so rushed by the wait staff that my wife had to facetiously ask "need the table?"  Horrible pacing. No time between appetizers and entrees.  Last night arrived around 6PM. A few seats at the bar and two four-tops available. Hostess asked if we'd like to sit at the bar. No thank you, I replied.  She then hem-hawed for a few moments then said she'd "have to check". After being left standing there for a few minutes we decided to walk over to Houston's where we were seated immediately and had an excellent meal.  Slanted Rice could take lessons on customer service. Too many other good options around to be subjected to poor service.

E8Dt6VB_vv7bU_34xhf-xw.text: Found this place on Yelp and just so happened to see it on DDD the day I bookmarked it.  This place is hard to find, there's an obstruction when you're coming from the south end of the parking lot that doesn't allow you to see their sign.   A friend and I walked in, were greeted by a hostess who told us there was only seating available at the bar. I was wildly confused because I took one look at the seating in the restaurant and noticed they were at half capacity. I chalked it up to possibly having reservations on the way, but it was weird especially because we were there 90 mins and only half of those unfilled tables had patrons in them during the time we were there.   At the bar we were greeted by a bartender, who during our visit was extremely overwhelmed.   The good: the pork short ribs are awesome, so is the sauce that accompanies it. We also had sweet pork sweet rolls that may be one of the tastiest dishes I've had in years, the vegetables inside were incredibly fresh. We also shared the banh mi, which was in flatbread (different but not in a bad way), it was full of flavor and spice.  I ordered the pho with tenderloin and my friend had a clay pot with chicken. My pho was incredibly underwhelming, I couldn't even continue eating it and had them box it up. My friend really enjoyed his clay pot, I wish I got that as well.  There's a few more things on the menu I want to try so I will be back to evaluate them again. Based on the hostess thing and being relegated to the uncomfortable bar stools and seeing a large portion of the main seating not being utilized and the overwhelmed lone bartender, I gotta say the customer service needs work.  The food itself, especially the appetizers, warrant another try at the place.

ibb-m5eggX3H-G3U4_o4Iw.text: The food was ok. Not that there was anything wrong. Just not blown away. The atmosphere is alright; it's kinda dark in there for dinner like it's super fancy. The thing that I didn't like the most was how the staff was stand-off ish and very slow to do anything. They weren't very busy and we felt like the staff was either inexperienced or all very introverted trying to avoid contact with tables of people that they're meant to serve. When we called them over they were very polite and did just fine. I love pho and might go back again and give them another try.

Qra2VKsEGhyIoLs6Byyi4A.text: This one is mixed. Service was at best average. The pork shrimp spring roll ok. While the lettuce out  one end was visually pleasing. For the love of all things not sandy get a salad spinner and rinse the Lettuce spinner. I prefer lettuce without sand.   Ban mi wrap was real good, however the waiter was not that helpful with ban mi vs ban mi wrap. This wrap was more like the wrapping of a Gyro. Not bad though. Not the normal bread.   The only other thing I would mention was stickiness of the table. Like I mentioned mixed experience.

n9F28jKiXpri-ermnu1frQ.text: Came in today and had a sub par experience. Halfway through my vermicelli bowl i bit down on an egg roll and it was weirdly crunchy. I kept thinking it was part of the roll but it dissolved in my mouth and stuck to my teeth like sand. For the rest of the day i felt like when you go to the beach and accidentally get sand in your mouth and it won't go away. I told the food runner and the server about it and all he did was turn around and comp the egg roll. Honestly i just wanted to know what he had made me eat. Was it chemicals? Do you not clean your mushrooms? Do you add sand to your food? No consideration or understanding

K2K7pLgd2xOm0qm3o54jwQ.text: First time here. Our server was great, very friendly. The restaurant is nice but they had the music up so loud, you had to try and talk over it. But we just wanted good pho. Unfortunately, the broth tasted watered down and they serve you big bowls but not a lot of noodles. It's more expensive than other places in the valley too!  I'd rather go to a hole in the wall place where I pay less, have mediocre service but really good pho.  It's unfortunate because they have the service down but you gotta get the food right. Will definitely be getting my pho fix elsewhere.

002cKDIBPdeuWUku3xfreg.text: This is the perfect Vietnamese spot for a quick and delicious lunch in North Scottsdale. Set inside the Hilton Village shopping center behind the Chase Bank, there is seating both inside and outside with a cute shaded patio.   I had the tropical spring rolls and a Slanted size beef pho. The spring rolls had shrimp, vegetables, wonton strips, and mango. Everything was fresh and cool, a good contrasting juxtaposition with the hot beef pho. I enjoyed all the ingredients in the spring roll overall, but there were so little wonton chips in the roll that they didn't provide much of a texture difference in the dish. The miso vinaigrette dipping sauce and additional "grandma" chili sauce provided by my server were flavorful and great with the roll.  The pho was perfectly portioned for lunch. You'll find it in the appetizer section of the menu. It had a good ratio of beef to noodle, and I appreciated that the cilantro was a component placed on the side rather than chopped up into the soup. It was on the same plate with the requisite basil, bean sprouts and lime wedge. Overall I liked the pho. The beef was thinly sliced and very tender. The broth was more on the light side and didn't have a lot of depth or complexity of flavor as pho from other restaurants I've been to though.  Service was friendly and sweet from Priscilla.   If I'm in the area and craving Vietnamese food this is a good option to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Slanted size beef pho
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tropical spring rolls

zVi86TUfEAsAZ2lOZc0TqA.text: Ok I was pleasantly surprised by the selection of dishes here. The crispy pork egg rolls were uniquely delicious. The oxtail pho was great but the crispy rice clay pot tenderloin shouldn't be missed.  Will definitely be back. Thanks Julian

124clpFZR6Oyi6FDmGqZPQ.text: What the heck?! This rating is not based on the food- I have been getting takeout pho from here for at least the past 2 years and love it! The clay pot meals are amazing too. So I called tonight to try to order some pho to go like I always do, and I am told they are not taking anymore to go orders tonight. At first I thought the guy on the phone was messing with me but then I realized he was being serious when he told me I could come in and sit at the bar instead. I have literally never heard of a restaurant that stops offering to go food because they are too busy that night (which was the explanation I got over the phone) -super disappointing! I really wanted my Slanted Rice pho lol

CHFOgvaJLjM_1ZS5YIpKQA.text: I am a regular at slanted Rice and I've recommended it to many of my friends and have had friends and family join me there. No one's ever been disappointed and have stated that they'll continue to dine there. I especially love their happy hour,

wAgwzNGT86-Fvj2TNbM9wg.text: I called to place an order for Pho Tai. If you call into an other Vietnamese restaurant, they would immediately know what dish you are requesting. The employee tried to up charge me by asking if I meant the combination pho and then stated there are two different types of steak for Pho Tai, which is incorrect according to their menu. My boyfriend unfortunately picked up the food and did not realize how skewed the price was before leaving as we were charged $35 for two bowls of pho tai?! xdiZ3dADmAYGNJ5fO3iDxw.text: It was a let down based on all the rave reviews. The rolls with fried prawns were lacking in flavor, the chicken wings were the very best thing we ordered. A good sized portion with lots of flavor. The garlic noodles were a very small portion of dry noodles with 4 over cooked shrimp. The chicken salad had gnarly chunks of non chewable parts. 14y6625M2K07rQhIqYss-g.text: We shared an order of the clay pot shrimp as per all of the recommendations and crispy pork eggrolls.  Did not disappoint!!  The (burnt) rice on the edges of the clay pot were my favorite bites even though every bite of everything was delicious.  The rice did look burned but it was perfect tasting.  The clay pot came with soup and salad. Soup and salad were both very nice but not amazing.  The egg rolls came with a sweet vinegar liquid which is a perfect combination with the eggrolls.  We used the lettuce to wrap our eggrolls in and help to bring more of the yummy liquid into the mix.  It was a bit pricey but the service and atmosphere were both spot on.  Our bill was $35 (before tip) for the 2 items mentioned and one rum and coke.  We enjoyed it very much and we will return.

DpOW6zKkcZqrYvmX-5s5bQ.text: Not your average Vietnamese restaurnant. Worth 5 stars but we had to wait an hour. They had 3 big tables came in before us and apologized.  Enjoyed specialty spring rolls and pho.  We will definitely be back when we are in town.

rkP1E_pDync1_Ps3PBt4Ig.text: Dinner for 2 on a Wednesday night at 8pm afew weeks ago. The weather was nice,we sat out on the patio. Vq03FA7PaOTgz2MeDY5Zsg.text: Can't take a To go order??? Wow, I guess they just don't like money.
