XLGY4xb0jjNLx9bJcCVANw.text: I can only report that this is my favorite place for Pho in Scottsdale, and it's definitely a nicer / cozier dining experience than the typical Pho, Asian, or fusion restaurant -- I haven't been disappointed after a dozen or so very large bowls.  I'm looking forward to trying something else on the menu but it's hard to break from my fav!

4DgigNSYFjLnwdWgJzVVbg.text: My second time here (plus one to go order) and I love it as much as the first. I've now had the lemongrass rice lunch plate with chicken, the garlic sauce wings, some pork spring rolls, and the beef pho. I have not been disappointed with anything and most of these items came from recommendations from their friendly staff. Very cute, modern decor. Love the music. Drink selection is very nice and I'm glad they support local breweries. The best part is that the things you wouldn't typically find in a Vietnamese restaurant have been knock outs! ie the chicken wings. Everything has a certain flair so it stays True to the concept.   I really love the staff. They are knowledgable and friendly and very welcoming. Keep it up Slanted Rice! I am hooked.

32b7BfrYWWz96aWsrimeLg.text: a quick and dirty review  I was in the area for a business trip, it was 3pm and I still had not had lunch. I love pho, it's my comfort food so I was glad I was able to find this place.  I ordered the steak pho and it was solid. The broth could use some work, but not bad at all. Don'y forget about the sauces!  There was barely anyone there since I was dining during off-hours, bur service was quick and polite.  The only negative I think can think about this experience is that this place is hard to find. I suggest reading the description on the yelp page to help locate the restaurant.

erFzqf9n8zs-dBVSTYYHhw.text: Come here all the time and never leave dissatisfied. Best pho in Arizona! If you come here ask for Chloe, she knows everything about the menu and has to be one of the best servers I have ever had!

idfs6BS4GuFpYFUOKn1pVw.text: I'll start with the place very nice in side and the service was great and very friendly. SXqjRpjdJ1CLsMgwxcpIdQ.text: I was appalled at the customer service from every angle here. Sat down, did not get food for an hour and 20 minutes tables around us had sat down, ate, and left before we even got our food. It was obvious they had forgotten. We heard every excuse from the printer was down to anything else. How about just admit you forgot to put the order in and apologize? So after the long wait there was a hair in the salad. When we told our server about the hair his reply was "Well who do you think did it?" FYI we don't care WHO or WHY there was a hair in the salad just fix it. After returning the food there was no apology and instead of asking what we would like instead the server rudely hit the check on the table about 10 minutes later. They seemed to be understaffed probably due to poor ownership/management. Another note to management, I have received food with hair in it and I have actually returned to the restaurant because they have good service and they HANDLED the problem. That was not the case here. Skip this restaurant there are plenty others.

hmi1N6CUTgtXO_Ru3CIxcw.text: Extremely good pho I loved it here! The service was great and attentive and there is an outdoor patio which is nice in the evening.

bpHgGikAHAMdSaoAFoO1ew.text: As a Vietnamese myself I would love to support my own people businesses but the pho here is so horrible. All you could taste is the spices which was way too overwhelming. On top of that a bowl for $12-14 dollars is way too much. Do yourself a favor n go to a more authentic place for cheaper. I get that this place is probably catering more to Caucasians and its fancier but the taste doesn't have to compromise. Spring rolls were ok can't go wrong when things are fried. We're from out of town so I wouldn't know whats better here in scottsdale.

35RRRvtonTJZHo-2_4UTiA.text: A perfectly fine Vietnamese-ISH meal in the heart of Scottsdale. Authentic Vietnamese? Not really. But still good. A decent Vietnamese-ish experience. Kind of like a watered down martini. It's watered down and doesn't pack the same punch, but it's still a martini!   Would we go back? If it's July or August and the other more authentic options are closed, yea, probably. Any other time of year? Meh. Probably not. There are too many other options.

J7LRpC_bmpMJICEr0RLRxQ.text: Loved this place! Would definitely visit next time I visit Scottsdale, want to try more on the menu. Service was great too. Grilled chicken salad was delicious and such a big portion. Clay pot rice was so good, juicy meat and lots of veggie.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak pho
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Clay pot rice with chicken

dDVQp8kSmkQswBS1I6jwCw.text: I'm not a Vietnamese food expert and so I'm not reviewing Slanted Rice with any kind of mindset that this is authentic Vietnamese food.  However If the food is good than who really cares?  Two words: shaken beef.  It really is amongst the most delicious dishes I've had in recent memory.  Filet beef, onions, and a great sauce (that next time I will order extra for).  The wings with garlic were also a major hit as were the garlic noodles.  We ended up ordering a second side of it mid meal.  Was not a fan of the pho or the crispy rice dish, but now I know what to get because the rest was phenomenal.  Staff was great, food was great, and I will be back ASAP as well as recommend to others.

Z2usdinjVadvr2FxtyHtFg.text: My fiance & I have been to every restaurant in the Hilton Village! This was the last place we hadn't tried. We wish we would have tried Slanted Rice sooner! It has an intimate feel! We loved the Lemongrass Brussel Sprouts and the Spring Rolls as an appetizer. We probably could have stopped there because we were feeling pretty full, but then we both had the vegetable pho! This was my first time having pho! It did not disappoint! Everything was delicious, fresh and reasonably priced! We will be going back!

KKWZjGPSVl7xpREryCWzlQ.text: One word - disappointed. But not unexpected. After all, it's in the middle of Scottsdale.   I love Vietnamese food and I consider myself a veteran - I've tried many Vietnamese restaurants in town. Their food is mediocre to say the best, and pricey as everyone else mentioned. I'd tolerate that if their service is good. But no. We waited for 45 minutes for two simple lunch specials and when they finally came, my order was wrong.   We are not going back for sure.

VUeTqDu0JvxagyCvBVj-Rw.text: Finally made it to Slanted Rice . . . and I was in Seventh Heaven!  What a beautifully designed space . . . and very comfortable!  I love the outside patio decor as well.   They offer a special lunch menu, but you can order off the main menu as well. There are so many choices from appetizers, salads, spring rolls, sandwiches, rice dishes, and dinner entrees. We had a difficult time deciding as we watched orders being delivered to other tables around us. Everything coming out of the kitchen looked amazing and fresh! Hubby and I decided to split two different spring rolls -- the Shrimp and Pork with peanut sauce and the Fried Tofu with peanut sauce. I have to say, they really know how to do peanut sauce!  Hue, one of the owners, also brought out some miso sauce to try as well with the rolls, and that was delicious as well!  Definitely many more rolls in our future.  We split the Crispy Rice in Clay Pot with chicken as our main entree. It was hands down the most tasty rice dish I have ever had. (And I am not a fan of rice to begin with!)  It also comes with a large bowl of soup and a good-sized salad. Definitely enough to share, but next time, I will order one just for myself. I almost inappropriately licked the bowl!!!  The owners Hue and Ty are very gracious and welcoming. I have already decided to have another lunch here later this week, and can't wait to bring in another group of friends for dinner so that we can experience more of everything!!!

uUzepOONs5VRvKEDKFwDMg.text: Don't over look this place. To start your greeted with pleasant service and classy atmosphere. The crispy rice clay pots and firecracker shrimp that followed a surprise broth & salad were all dressed / seasoned perfectly. Hands down best little gem in Scottsdale.

VXp25P0x_DRpXdcfNS_gfg.text: I ordered takeout for lunch one day and got the marinated charbroiled chicken rice plate. It was pretty good. It came with plenty of rice and a nice crisp salad with a very flavorful dressing. My only complaint is a lot of rice and not much chicken or salad. They also provided a sauce for the sticky rice,but it was still just a lot of rice left after I ate my chicken. I may order again, but for $9 just wish there was more to it. Probably better off actally eating in than a carry out.

r50RzXelNAbd-5QKytTRcA.text: Upscale Vietnamese food.  I was here for lunch and had a combo meal with grilled beef.  It was very nice and I enjoyed the friendly service and a casual lunch on their front patio.

pquRL4x8elNO5mNJ6B6eSA.text: I don't know what was worse, the food or the service. Or maybe the fact that I paid about twice as much as other Vietnamese restaurants who give me both better food and service. I'll never come back here again.  When I entered, I was never greeted. So I sat myself at the bar. The bartender never saw us and never greeted us and said she would be right with us. Instead, she finished what she was doing and a few minutes later asked if we needed a water. What a slap in the face. We ordered two bowls of pho and spring rolls. It literally took 30 minutes to come out!! For pho? The broth is already made! Geez. I've never waited that long before. To add insult to injury, when it finally came out, my bowl was luke warm; not even hot. As a matter of fact, the rare beef never fully cooked in my broth. It stayed pink and rare and mushy. And the noodles were over cooked and mushy too. I bet they had my bowl sitting on a counter with piping hot broth for 15 minutes. And it continued to cook my noodles. But then it cooled down. They probably dropped the steak in lated and served me a bowl of cold soup. If you're going to charge $5 more per bowl than other Vietnamese restaurants, maybe you should either serve it hot or have amazing service. What a bust. If the owner knew this was going on, I know he'd have someone's head for it

7ktDi7ESv9E-ODukNwWA4g.text: Their staff is very friendly, and the food is consistently good. My favorite starter is the Garlic Butter Edamame. My favorite entree thus far is the Crispy Rice in Clay Pot with chicken, had it five times and enjoyed it every time. I also highly recommend the Garlic Noodles as a side dish to share with one person.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Firecracker Shrimp and Garlic Noodles, I highly recommend this epic meal.
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Edamame with garlic butter! You&#39;ll never eat plain style again after having it this way :)

_mWZIF74c8DF2rA6ZI9q8Q.text: First, I suggest skipping the Pho. I know it's most people's go to for Vietnamese, but there is much better for less price at many places. However, the clay pot is outstanding! Would be five stars, but I had the Pho and that is a minus. I would suggest that they just take it off the menu and maybe offer some other dishes like crispy noodles.   Everything else we had, spring rolls, the rice clay pot, and a grilled chicken over rice was excellent. The service was good and pretty knowledgeable of the menu and the atmosphere was calming without being too stuffy. It's a small space, so reservations may be needed during busier times.

ydXphMJJi6VPo7ev_e-0Ew.text: Nice lil spot convenient to work. Only reason I'm not giving it 5/5 is bc I'd like to see more vegan options.  Had the Pho w tofu and it was pretty yummy.  Definitely going back.

fANECWoBMmZJu8f4wgG2QQ.text: I'm so confused by all the positive reviews of this place maybe it was an off day but I was just not impressed... and frankly super irritated.  So, I pull into the parking lot based off of my smartphone directions, the restaraunt is located in a long strip mall/shopping plaza. I gave them a call to find out specifically where they were located.  I was parked near the Starbucks which is smack dab right in the middle of the strip mall.    I called and asked "I'm at the Starbucks, where are you in relation to the Starbucks?" The girl who handled my phone call tells me that they're at the end of the complex.  Oooookay.  I replied, is that the north end or the south end? She said to go right from the Starbucks.   Well depends on whether your are facing east or west at the Starbucks.  I tried to get more information from her but it was clear that she was directionally challenged.  We ended up walking to one end - not there and then to the other end... found it!   Typical of this location and area the place was decorated nicely and very modern and clean looking. They had a nice small patio outside and my son chose to have us sit there.    Food:  This is what we ordered: Salt & Pepper Calamari $10 Spring Rolls Pork & shrimp with peanut sauce $4 Pho Thai $12 Pho Meatballs $10 (I think) Thai Iced Tea $4  Salt & Pepper Calimari - it's Calamari steak, breaded in panko and deep fried.  It's served with fried jalapenos and onions and a spicy mayo dipping sauce.  The sauce is what makes this dish decent.  The calamari is nothing special, very similar to something that was supplied from a frozen food company.    Pho Soups:  Broth was meh - mediocre at best.  It lacked the depth of flavors that I've had elsewhere. The Pho herb & sprouts plate was sufficient but my cilantro looked like it had been frozen and thawed and given to me.  Eeeeek.    Thai Iced Tea: Came pre-mixed, made me think that they didn't make it here since it wasn't layered.  Spring Rolls:  This was supposed to be an appetizer but was served to us AFTER we were almost done with our pho and AFTER I told the waiter not to serve it to us since we didn't get it as an app.  Service:  Service was ok but has plenty of room for improvement.  1.  They forgot my spring roll appetizer, after we had been already partaking of the soup. The waiter asked if we got it, I said no and told them no need to bring it out now and they did anyways with no apologies.  People, take some advice, it COSTS you nothing to apologize.  It's FREE.  It's just a word that has value but costs you nothing from your own wallet... use it when it needs to be used.  When I first started this review it had 2 stars... once I checked my leftovers... I took it down to one because I can't even re-eat it... (see below)  So we ended up leaving with lots of leftovers, the calamari app, a full order of spring rolls and our soups.  I get home this evening, unpack our food and am completed frustrated to find that they didn't include the peanut dipping sauce for the spring rolls NOR the calamari dipping sauce for the calamari.    What a waste of my hard earned money, I recommend that you don't waste  yours.      If you're looking for some great Vietnamese fare, definitely check out my other reviews of other restaurants in the valley that will KNOCK your socks off without the cost.

jhQhtqHSkA5xenUkeUFjnw.text: This just happened.  I'm at lunch sitting at the bar.  Mid meal the waiter slams his hand down on the counter and traps and smudges a fly with his bare hand right next to my plate as I was eating.  18 inches away from my plate.  After a pause he checked to make sure fly was dead, then wiped it into a bin and washed his hands.  I had to ask the bartender to wipe off the counter.  Then the waiter verbally accosted me for writing a review on yelp.

yTBczB0akmFFz1_6ASn6Aw.text: Fabulous!! I've had this place bookmarked since I saw it on DDD and it didn't disappoint. Friend and I went with waitresses recommendation of brussels sprouts that we're addicting. We nearly licked the bowl. Really wish I could make this one at home!  We split an entree of chicken something or another and a spring roll. I would request a side of peanut sauce to go with spring roll. Everything was fresh, and flavored to perfection.  Thank you Slanted Rice!

mQW3AmaqRXCZmgTuDPYY9g.text: After watching Triple D, I had to make a stop here. Decided to try it it for my birthday dinner. This place didn't disappoint. The waiter was super helper since we were all first timers, even let us order some time after happy hour & still get the specials. I have a Clay Pot Crispy Rice with Chicken. The chicken & veggies hold a lot of flavor. Once you get down further in the rice it does have a lovely crisp. It is very hot when it comes out FYI Before dinner I had the dragon lady roll. So yummy & the miso dipping sauce was great. My dinner also came with a salad & soup before. Only complaint I would have is that I wish I didn't get so full so fast!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eukVnKa24Zk0tm4PobLxUQ.text: I saw this place on Guy Fieri's tv show 'Diners Drive-ins and Dives' and I could not wait to visit. I am from San Diego and we have a lot of Vietnamese choices but Slanted Rice was one of the best I have ever tasted. Ha was our server and he was so attentive and accommodating for our family of 6 bringing out lots of food with extra bowls so we can all try some. Everything was so fresh and the restaurants atmosphere was upbeat and inviting. I wish I could have this place back home. I will definitely be back when I visit Scottsdale in the future

VHZdeBMWKTR7Vh9Kxo7YqQ.text: Killer garlic noodles!! Oh mama. I could eat those off a bathroom floor they're so good. I love the bahn mi as well and my wife always gets the pork. Pricey place, but worth it to treat yourself for some excellent Vietnamese food. Also, staff is super friendly and sweet. Highly recommend!

PWL5v27WcZENyL93AkEI6w.text: This was our first and last time at this restaurant. We went with friends pre birthday and our waiter seemed annoyed at waiting on us. He then let us order pho and salad for the table when that comes with each dinner. When we were surprised to receive a second soup and salad he said "it tells you that on the menu with no apologies. We then received our meals, 3 clay pots and our friends were not made without sauce, as requested, and had to be sent back. Again, no apologies and they began to turn up the lights and asked to remove our flowers from the table. Pitiful experience and we were not the only ones left at 9:30 pm when they close at 9:00. It was SO obviously poorly managed and an unpleasant experience at best. Food was okay, I have had much better, and we enjoyed ourselves despite their lack of effort and apologies. I will never return again.

-0ci-gqLwYQ8aE2jSDEW9A.text: This was a fabulous dinner, we ended up back two weeks later. The dragon spring rolls are amazing. Soup and salad are included with the entrees. I had the chicken in a clay pot. Never had anything like this, I highly recommend it. My husband had the beef entree also wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dragon spring rolls
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KeDCajma4YaqQc3hvxjH1Q.text: Came on a Sunday and service was speedy and food was so fresh and delicious! We got the Shakin Beef, chicken pho, and fried tofu peanut sauce spring roll. Will be coming back here for sure. And the restaurant itself is clean, quaint, and adorable. Loved it!

xsM5GnP7X2rRkAMdWXEdog.text: We came here with coworkers and had a large party that was easily accommodated.  The waitress was super friendly, and was very in tune to my dairy intolerance.  I ended up ordering the filet shaken beef which was delicious!  It came with a lime wedge and some dipping sauce with rice.  My meal came with soup and salad and everything was great.  The space was a little dark, but other than that it was a great spot for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

KSEOoZ9Pm6kTncp04Piazg.text: I had dinner last night at the bar. I believe it's not the best place to be in this tiny place, in order to enjoy what it has to offer. The rush/stress of the waitressing crew was palpable. It took the barista a bit of time to give me a drink of water and menu, not that it would have bothered me too much had I been acknowledged beforehand. The beef Pho I had was good, nothing outstanding  in regards to the taste and there was not too much meet in the bowl.   It was an okay experience and I  wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to go back.

HM-fd_oE-regOKiz9RSFUw.text: Update: We went in again for dinner and had a horrible experience.   We decided to order a bunch of dishes so we could try more things and so we could have some leftovers to take home since we loved it so much last time. So we ordered the pork spring rolls, crispy ribs, lemongrass chicken, a shrimp and a steak clay pot, and a side of lemongrass stir fry veggies.   We started out okay with the pork spring rolls. Then we got the ribs and lemongrass chicken, neither of which were anything special. Just fried meat with dipping sauces that lacked flavor.   Then we got the clay pots. We both ordered one this time because we loved them SO much last time, but these clay pots were nowhere near what we had previously. Last time, the rice was buttery, rich, and incredibly crave-worthy, but the chicken was dry. I asked our server what she recommended since the chicken was dry last time, and she made it sound like the chicken is always dry in the clay pots (you'd think they would do something about that), so she recommended the shrimp instead. The shrimp was definitely better than the chicken. However, this time the clay pot came out WAY hotter than last time (inedibly hot) and half of the rice was burnt, and the other half was not crispy at all on the bottom. If you haven't had this dish before, the rice typically has an amazing golden crust on the bottom that's slightly crispy and super flavorful. The burnt rice gave the whole dish a burnt flavor. Also, this time the mushrooms were rubbery and completely inedible. This was the same on both clay pots that we ordered. That's $40 of food that was not enjoyable.   The lemongrass stir fry veggies were also disappointing. It tasted like water-logged vegetables were tossed in a sugary sauce with a hint of lemongrass. Not good. I feel like all of the food here is unnecessarily sweet when it could be salty, savory, sour, and so many other flavors.   We told our server about our food and she said that one other chef is definitely better at making clay pots than the chef that was working that night. She also said that other customers had complained about their clay pots being unevenly cooked, too. But the kicker - she said this in a way that made it seem like it was normal and happened all the time, and she did not offer to do anything to improve our experience (i.e. allow us to order something else, take one of the dishes off of the bill, get a manager, etc.).   When she came back with our check, she apologized for the food and we said we were very disappointed and wouldn't come back unless the other chef was there (who she said was named Manny). Then she told us the chef working that night was her fiance! That made us feel like she wasn't offering to fix the problem because she didn't want her fiance to get in trouble.   Our check showed the full balance for all of the food we ordered. After paying and on our way out, I asked to speak with a manager. She said there wasn't one on duty, that they were short a manager and it was just her, and the owners were not there.   This experience was so completely opposite from our first visit that we likely won't be back. The difference in the quality of the food was the difference between one of the best meals and one that never would have brought us back to the restaurant. And the service was awful. She even told us she doesn't have the authority to take anything off of the bill. I don't understand how the owners could be so careless to leave someone in charge without the authority to fix issues, nor the desire to do so.   We recently went out to dinner to another restaurant, which was a $50 bill compared to our $100 bill here, and we remarked that we could not believe we spent so much on such a mediocre meal at Slanted Rice.

5ISq8X_fwmSb4lbfoP-s7A.text: Extremely expensive for the amount of food, plus the food isn't even that good. The food is barely seasoned and pretty bland. I think since Guy Fieri liked it, the place gets more hype and business than it actually should. Definitely won't be back.

W_IHaVkUuvFY_f0shOydEg.text: I came here after reading all the great reviews about the Filet Mignon Shaken Beef. I am glad I checked this place out because the food was delicious!   I ordered the beef pho and my friend and I shared the other items. My friend and I shared the pork egg rolls and shaken beef.  The beef pho broth was a bit on the sweeter side but it all worked out once I added some hot sauce to it. The shaken beef was very tasteful and it was nice to be able to order the lunch special version of it. The egg rolls were good and it was nice to share a variety of food.  The service was decent since it took some time to get certain things. I've been a server and I've had good and bad days so I'm not going to be too critical on that.   The restaurant has a nice outdoor patio if you would like to eat outside. It wasn't too busy when I went here so there was plenty of seating available. The prices were a bit high from what I am used to paying in Sacramento but it is what it is. I would definitely come back here for my shaken beef and pho fix.   I also ordered the wine special which was $10 for a half bottle of wine. The special was for La Crema and it was delicious!   It's also cool to know that Guy Fieri came by here also!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork Egg Rolls
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wine Special for $10
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guy Fieri was here

QGpJof60Q9elMNiRL0Lpqg.text: I'm so glad I tried this place.  It's hard to do pho wrong so I look for what else makes a Vietnamese restaurant good.  Egg rolls were nice size and delicious  Charbroiled pork vermicelli was on point.  They give you plenty of chopped veggies and the pork had a nice crunch to it and tasty.  Veggie clay pot was yummy.  My daughter gave it 2 thumbs up   Garlic noodles and shrimp-  noodles were good but disappointed that shrimp was heavily breaded.

aUI7G24Icrp2wy8a45GKVQ.text: This is hands down my top 3 favorite restaurants. We usually start off with some eggs rolls and lemongrass wings, which are crispy and tasty! It includes a side salad and tasty soup. The shaken beef, juicy filet with onions which are soooo good and the firecracker shrimp with garlic noodles. These garlic noodles are to die for and I try to take a side order to go. The clay pots and pho are good too! If you want a side of pho, they have smaller portions compared to getting their full sized entree portion. I've taken my friend here (who doesn't typically love Asian restaurants) and she loved it so much she went back with her sister the same week! It's not a large restaurant, so be sure to make reservations for the weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lemongrass Wings
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Peanut dressing with side soup. Love love the flavor of the broth!
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filet Mignon Shaken Beef

e9mYj5iWnI0FWhIFgs366Q.text: I love Pho, and when I read the Yelp reviews I knew I had to try Slanted Rice.  My wife and I both ordered Pho, though I was very tempted to try one of their other dishes.  But, the True test od. Vietnamese restaurant is the Pho. Surprisingly the broth is vegetarian, but you won't miss the flavor of a beef bone broth.  My only complaint was the mushrooms.  They were sliced unevenly. The thin ones complemented the broth, but the thick ones had a strong "woodsy" taste, and overwhelmed the broth. But I will be back to try the other dishes

5-WI2XIU8cuW_1OkRybUKg.text: Unfortunately, this great located Vietnamese restaurant has worse customer service I've seen.  Food was OK, but service deserve 0 stars.

aTAvIrQoJ-bz100AZug1ww.text: I would give this place 0 stars, if I could. They barely deserve 1 star because of their awful customer service. One pompous waiter with an accent is the worst offender. The first time my bf went here, Julian ignored him until my bf went to the bar. The second time we got an Asian bartender who was okay. We went there about two more times, always sitting at the bar since table service was lacking. Unfortunately, the fourth time we sat at the bar, the bartender was talking to other female servers and paying more attention to their conversation than the bar. I could hear the girls giggling and talking about doing Cocaine. I understand that people do drugs, but the fact that they discussed it so blatantly at work is not appropriate. They were more focused on dimwitted conversation than their jobs.                                                             So the next time we sat, we tried a table again. The restaurant was practically empty, and nobody came to help us. No one even sat us, and nobody brought water or said anyone would be with us. I could see the employees standing and chatting in the back completely oblivious. When we walked out, my bf was so upset I hung back to say something. The egocentric Julian, denied that we had been waiting there, did not apologize for anything and acted like he was god's gift to women. I honestly don't know what this guy's issue is but he's clueless and definitely should not be a server. He has no idea how to handle customers or even say the right thing. He just has "slime ball" written all over him. I have never met a more rude server.      As for the food, it's mediocre. I've had way better Vietnamese food at many other places in AZ.                                                                        I love spring rolls and the ones here are bland. I also tend to gravitate towards lemongrass and curry dishes. The curry was just like any other curry I've had elsewhere. And the lemongrass dish was a huge disappointed. It did not taste authentic at all, more importantly it wasn't good. The garlic noodles that come with the prawns are oily and slathered in too much butter. The noodles were stringy and lacked flavor. Of course this is not the worst Vietnamese food I'll ever have, but it definitely is nothing special. The only thing I ever liked was the calamari.              The pho at Tea Light Cafe is just as good as this one and there is actually real customer service at Tea Light Cafe. Imagine that! Customer service at a restaurant!                                   I am speaking from experience as I have been a server. I know it is not an easy job but whoever is hiring these "employees" needs to step up their game or clean house. The awful service is the main reason I am never going back here again.                                                       But, if you decide you're okay with rude servers talking about their drug habits, get the calamari; it's the only thing you could be happy with ordering.

9F-X0YvW-OdnMdWzWbE5Bw.text: We were there the other day for lunch and both of us had the Clay Pot. It was yummy. I tried the Pho last time which I liked as well. Great place for a different flavor from other Asian fare.

OjCRVCMzfgXvys-BzGTuRA.text: This place is NOT KID FRIENDLY. Does not have high chairs. My husband and I had to walk out with a 3-year old and an 18-month old because there was no accommodation for the 18-month old. (And my children are *extremely* well behaved in restaurants).

j3Fc7c-Hpjc5MaLPb-V9EA.text: Slanted Rice has become our go-to for take out.  The owners are always so friendly and accommodating and everything we've tried have been delicious.  Faves: Pho - mandatory hangover cure.  SO MUCH better than Noodles Ranch.  There is actual complexity in the broth.  If you're a broth junkie like me, their scallion broth that comes with the entrees (and you can order separately as well) is the same as their pho broth.  Garlic Noodles - Such an genius idea!  Fragrant but not overbearing garlic flavor and some added mmmMMMmmmm with a sprinkle of cheese.  Great with sriacha if you're into spice.  Clay Pot Rice - I really wish they did this with Chinese sausage but ehhhhhh... What you're really looking to get here is that crispy rice goodness all around the clay pot.  DO NOT GET THIS TO GO.  You will miss out on the crispiness!  What you want to do is to mix everything together so you get all of the flavors of the chicken and mushrooms and sauce and the awesome crunch texture of the rice sprinkled in.  YUM.  Sooooo... not to be a Noodles Ranch hater, but seriously drive the two miles north and come try this place (all you Colonial Grand dwellers - looking at you).  You won't regret it!

iu5AwRpgZME7P7ZkqadIhg.text: We ate there about two weeks ago for lunch.  It was a beautful day, so we sat outside.  Good choice.  The owner and staff were very nice and very helpful.  I had the Crispy Rice in a Clay Pot with Chicken.  Our server highly recommended it. Although it didn't sound  that great, since I had never had it before, I thought "Sure!"   And man, I'm glad that I did.  Delicious.  If you get it, be sure when the dish comes out that you scrape the rice off from the around sides and bottom of the pot.  The releases the heat (it's HOT) to cool it off a bit and releases some of the flavor as well. My wife and sister-in-law got the rice vermicelli with chicken and both thought they were very good.

FCJIEb4VsBUnTIOcrKtaSg.text: We live on the other side of town, but come over especially for this place. It's the best Pho in town and the owners are a lot of fun and super nice people. We even order it through Postmates when we can. My favorite is the shrimp and vegetables pho. You won't be disappointed!

Q2wrz2Izm6d1LhlmadOUFA.text: This would be 3.5 stars if possible: 4 for the food and 3 for the service.  We came in, were seated with food but not beverage menus then waited what seemed a long time.  I think this is another restaurant that has cut back on staff because of the minimum wage increase.  Since we haven't been here before, we don't know if this has slightly increased food prices, as well.  We had an appetizer and two entrees all of which were excellent. Come for the food if you don't mind waiting.

smQxC4329XKovGmHSfuZNQ.text: Everything I've had here has been great.Very nice atmosphere. I recommend the clay pot for your first visit. Bianca is awesome!

pjiTPbkNrBXb7SDpooYqhA.text: My husband and I decided to try this place based on all of the Yelp reviews. Service was on point the day that we came in. The pepper shrimp was the highlight of the meal! I don't know what was more tasty the lightly breaded shrimp or the sauce. Since the firecracker shrimp received rave reviews my husband ordered that. Well I convinced him to because I was afraid it would be too spicy for me, but it wasn't. My husband was obsessed with the garlic noodles on that dish!  This place is a little more pricy than a traditional Pho establishment but it's definitely nice to splurge. Get the pepper shrimp!

saif6iaUgu0xdTvAakPcHw.text: Pho king awesome. I had the Pork Bahn Mi wrap, veggie spring rolls and plum wine ice cream with fried bananas. The spring roll was huge, fresh, cool and delightfully crunchy. The Bahn mi had a modern twist with a pita wrap instead of hoagie and a nice lightly spicy mayo. Even with the reduction in bread it was large and filing and the pork was cooked perfectly.  And the plum ice cream and bananas were so amazing that even though I was already full, I had to finish them.  The staff were really nice and very attentive without hovering.  Plus the happy hour prices are insanely low. I felt like I was robbing them. ...but no complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Modern pork Bahn mi....Super tasty!
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie Spring Roll...large,  cool and refreshing with a good crunch.
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Plum wine ice cream with fried bananas.

Ocb4phOq2234086aswGcdQ.text: I decided to come here on a weekday for some lunch. Of course I really wanted to try their Pho noodle soup and I also ended up getting takeout in the process which was the grilled pork with steamed rice dish. There was also some salad included which was a nice surprise. While the Pho noodle soup was decent, the rice dish was a bit disappointing. It could just be the one that I ordered but there was no fish sauce and some hot soup would have really been appreciated. Also the portions were not very big for what I ordered compared to some of the other Vietnamese restaurants that I have been to. This was mainly True for the rice plate which was much smaller than expected.  Looking through the reviews on here I would have to agree that while this place has decent Vietnamese food, there are more authentic and cheaper options if you head elsewhere and the prices are quite high for what you get. I believe I spoke with the owners who are really nice people and had a genuine interest to get to know me so that's good. I also really liked the atmosphere of this place but sadly I'm not sure if I'll return due to the reasons that I mentioned.

E_veCCcf-Y48tKLWrqX8ZQ.text: Can you change the name of your restaurant so it isn't derogatory towards Asians? I'm sure you were thinking it was funny and catchy. But there are lots of other names that could be used as an alternative, right? Pho Sure!

uX4qXvsTS2Scv7EcTflTyg.text: Constantly good food, it's always hot and does not take a long time. This is the best place I have had Vietnamese food in a really long time. It was my best kept little secret but this is a gem that everyone should enjoy. I recommend everyone to try it at least once! Love at first bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp spring rolls AWESOME!! Every time I come here it&#39;s always great food, great company &amp; awesome service. Thank you Ty &amp; Wei

u01pSy48A0A7kB9y1ueU1g.text: The music was a little loud and did not particularly fit with the ambiance...but good food trumps all.  The pho soup was very good...I got the type with shrimp and the shrimp was very good as well.

ofvZE1AziZ5l8Fb-UdzYFA.text: not sure what to think of this place the food was good but not that much flavor really Americanized it was just missing something the service was OK but for price of the food you would expect better the firecracker shrimp was the best of what we had but over all not bad will go go back try some of the other things

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Firecracker shrimp

vkqRBVq9fog44OEKj5g8vg.text: Amazing..never had pho or vietnamese food before.. have to say that this is the best in the valley. Would . recommend it to anyone. . Become one of my favorite places.. I suggest the pho or shaken beef

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grandma&#39;s banh xeo.. vietnamese crepes are amazing

jqnauJa6Bdptk01QP4njAA.text: Nice restaurant with good ambience and GREAT service.  I'm a gastronomic snob particularly when it comes to food of my Motherland (I'm Viet).  I also live in Westminster California near the heart of Little Saigon.  Coming to Scottsdale for a business trip, I didn't want to go to a Viet restaurant because I was afraid of being disappointed.  However, local colleagues insisted so here we were.  Very pleasantly  surprised at the quality and variety and creativity of the food presented.  Thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Papa Tran&#39;s Special
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bún Tht Nng Ch Giò

r9_D_hgDyZ43C38FZ81kUg.text: This is the best food and experience I've ever had!  I travel all over the world, and wandered in here because of the lively crowd and great smell.  I was welcomed with happy faces with great recommendation and amazing food!!!!  You have to try this and for sure, you will be back!  Try the spring rolls and crispy rice...and make sure to dig down in the clay pot to get the Crispy part of the rice!!!

34UC2Rg2yso4foeaeeiqlQ.text: Ordered the chicken pho today and it would have been delicious but I encountered plastic in my food! NOT COOL

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VDma38S1VSODzludbSG1nA.text: From out of town in area for a business trip. Looked up on Yelp to see if there is a vietnamese cuisine in the area. Found Slanted pRice , decided to stop in for a good dinner. Food is okay, was very pricey . Served small portion. Most likely not coming back.

edJn_Ontung8ph2mD8Kwzg.text: So Pho is my favorite food in the world, and I've been on a mission to try as many pho places in the valley as I can. I don't do a lot of reviews, but I felt this place warranted one. Slanted Rice has a very chill and welcoming vibe upon walking in. I immediately found the service to be very fast and friendly.   I ordered the combination pho, and it ranks up there as one of the better bowls I've had. There was a good and balanced about of meat, and noodles, and a generous side serving of your typical pho garnishing and sauces (basil, bean sprouts, hoisin etc). Broth was very hearty, but not too oily, as I've found at some places. My only "gripe" might be that it's a bit pricey in comparison to some places (but I'm a poor college student, so lots of things are pricey for me lol)- the combo pho was $14, but I'd honestly get it again.

y3cy1yDdDrL9RJSw8AuXqw.text: The restaurant looks nice and clean. The service was pretty good but the food... it wasn't what I expected and not in a good way. I love pho and I eat it all the time but what they serve is not pho. I mean it is their version of pho I guess but they have altered it so much it might as well just be watered down broth with beef and soggy noodles. It lacked flavor.   We also had the crispy pork egg roll and fried dumplings and it was just ok.

3fctwyaXwShhcMjOMsF97A.text: I called to order a pickup.  The guy who answered told me to "hold for just one minute."  9 minutes on hold and he didn't pick back up so I hung up and tried again.  I called 13 more times (no exaggeration) and it was busy.  I called a 14th time and he picked up and said "I'm going to put you on hold for one minute."  I said, "I was just on hold for 9 minutes..." and he said "Well, we're busy." I said "goodbye." Rude and apparently no concern for their customers...so I ordered from another restaurant.  No problem there.

zQfI2QYXo3GMI7k0r0-jwQ.text: Coming from LA, it's hard for me to really enjoy pho elsewhere and I really wanted to like this place but... yeah.  The interior decor is really nice, very clean. Our big party of 11 was seated right away and waters were brought. Our server was really nice and attentive!  My main ish is that the price is way too high and the food was just ok. We had also ordered cafe su da and it just didn't taste the same. It had a powdery texture and tasted extremely watered down.  Parking lot is fairly decent sized so no problems there!

i5WSa2xRRF5UZfeBM7ncig.text: Came here on a Thursday night. The restaurant seemed pretty busy but not too busy to seat us right away. The firecracker shrimp and garlic noodles, although a bit salty, were very good. The yellow curry also had good flavors: it is a bit more soup-like.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yellow curry
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Clay pot

AlxE-si1rIusF5I56NgFNg.text: Food and service were exceptional. Wouldn't have known about this restaurant had I not been watching DDD on Food Network. The clay pot entree was beyond amazing. Can't wait to go back

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Scallop clay pot with bok choy and shiitake mushrooms
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp spring roll

fZ1FOJvZQdqc09Oopv0NnA.text: I have been to Slanted Rice twice now... and both times have enjoyed wonderful food, drink, and service!    On this most recent visit, the girlfriend and I showed up about 30 minutes prior to closing on a weekend.  We were seated quickly and, being a weekend, it was time to get our drink on... so we ordered the Lychee-infused vodka cocktail.  The flavor was good, but it did not seem to have much alcohol it in... although that all changed once I took a bite of the lychee at the bottom of the drink - it was like a eating a shot of vodka!    For my meal, I opted for a couple of appetizers.  The shrimp and pork spring rolls were very good.  The rolls ended up being a little messy, but that peanut sauce... oh that peanut sauce - soooo good!  The banh mi wrap was a creative and awesome take on the traditional  banh mi!  I could literally eat this wrap every single day!  The pita wrap is perfect... and a perfectly delicious compliment to this banh mi!    Already looking forward to my next visit to Slanted Rice!  *****FIVE STARS*****

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banh mi wrap!!
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp and pork spring roll!

Yz1TO8IlhiELKTnNWVeFfw.text: The service here wasn't the issue. Their food was not up to my par. Not sure if they are catering to their surrounding but all the dishes seem off. If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food this isn't it. It's more of an American fusion, which I wasn't aware if they are?  I do not recommend ordering pho from this place. They do not have condiments for the pho like hoisin sauce, sriracha, chili paste; none. They only serve it with a plate of bean sprouts, basil leaves and a slice of lime.  I ordered the chicken pho and the broth had a weird herbal taste to it, not in a good way.   Their charbroiled rice plate didn't have much flavor either. The pork in the dish was very dry and tough which was quite disappointing.   The one order of spring roll literally is one spring roll cut in half, quite pricey. It wasn't good either. The end of my spring roll got to my table dry.. almost too dry it was hard.   One thing I would only come back for and reorder would be their Salt and Pepper Calamari. Full of flavor and just the right amount of crispy-ness. Not too salty either.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Marinated Charbroiled Rice Plate
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp and Pork Spring Roll
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Pho

Pfq4Tq6LOGCHZuVEx2GhEw.text: When I have Vietnamese food on the brain, I can't be stopped. My brain orders: need spring rolls + a huge bowl of vermicelli, veggies, tofu and herbs in my belly now!  We arrived about an hour before closing and were able to get a seat on the patio, which was quite nice. The menu features a fair amount of veggie-friendly dishes, but just ask if you're worried that something might contain fish or oyster sauce because it doesn't always clearly indicate. For example, anything containing lemongrass sauce is not vegetarian as it contains oyster sauce. So, no Brussels for me, sadly, but hey, when there's a vegetarian spring roll with crispy won ton, asparagus and avocado w/ miso sauce, there's no reason to be sad about this.   Normally I'm all about the bun, but I couldn't pass up one of the crispy rice bowls (not seeing it on the online menu but I swear they have these). This was exactly what I needed, a cast iron pot filled to the brim with bok choy (my favorite!) and other veggies, plus tofu and loads of that slightly charred crunchy rice. This is one of my favorite things to eat and this did not disappoint.   If I lived in Phoenix, no doubt Slanted Rice would be on my regular rotation. Check it out when you're looking for both healthy and robust food!

x2t_lCk1Pl9HiVWckYcHlg.text: This place was just what I needed - healthy, warm, and veggie-filled. Bonus: all tucked onto a cozy patio.   My love for Vietnamese cuisine runs deep and it's even better when said Vietnamese eatery offers an abundance of vegan and veggie options given my shellfish/seafood allergy. Lucky for me, the pho broth here does not feature fish sauce and it was chock full of delicious veggies and tofu. I also enjoyed the salted edamame appetizer and vegetarian tofu spring rolls with peanut sauce.   Located in a strip mall with an abundance of parking, I could see this place being my go-to if I lived in the area. They offer both indoor and outdoor seating, coconut water, Vietnamese coffee and Thai iced teas. You know, all of the important stuff. Overall, a very delicious visit.

qk2WtbhlTg2eetx0mclBIg.text: How cool is it that Guy Fieri was here and featured this place on his show? I didn't know that coming in, and I got to sit right next to his signature on the wall.   Full disclosure, my boyfriend and I came in very hungover and we just needed some pho as comfort food. I ordered a small pho ga (chicken pho) and he ordered a large pho tai. The pho ga was pure salvation. It was very, very small but it was the perfect portion for me at the time. Boyfriend enjoyed his large pho tai a little less (I think he said it was missing more onions and other herbs), but then again, we're spoiled by the fact that we normally get our pho from Little Saigon in OC.   The restaurant feels really fancy. It's decorated so beautifully and looks very modern with the classy bar. There's also the option to sit outside in the small patio. Is it the most authentic-tasting Vietnamese restaurant? I'm not sure about that. But it's definitely a gem if you're looking for Viet food in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Small pho ga

47Ui2BY4GyBiHWL0HggldA.text: I really wanted to love this place, but the food is pricey for the quantity and quality, I paid $30+ for lunch, which is fine if the food is spot on, however this was not. A few other Reviewers mentioned, the flavors of the food was off, in a weird way,  and I agree. to me it seemed  "white washed" for a Caucasian palate.   I ordered the garlic noodles with prawns. The seasoning on the prawns was good, sadly, the star of the show, the garlic noodles was an oily, mushed mess, noodles were cold, (not made to order) and disappointing. Maybe I caught this place on a bad day.

EaHUul4MDsRSEdlPvSqVeQ.text: So...three nights ago...I was minding my own business watching Triple D and saw this place that 1. was close to home and 2. had pho and my yelp antennas went up!!!! "umm yes count me in" I thought,  I swiftly  added it to my "places I need to go" collection and now here I sit...(well technically there I sat...lol)    So basically Guy Fieri sent me, I should have told them that when I walked in and maybe I wouldn't have waited over 20mins for my starter?! and another 15 from my apps... but via ease dropping on the couple two tables down it was a long wait kinda night. When we got there they were siting I assumed they had finished and just enjoying each others company turns out they too were waiting. None the less I wasn't in a huge hurry and little baby (my youngest) was keeping me entertained.  I ordered spring rolls, crispy rice and shrimp. Come to find out two orders of spring rolls is actually really 2 spring rolls... so if there a lot of you I'd skip this app... plus as you can see they were mostly lettuce. I had a vegetarian with fried tofu and a miso dipping sauce and little baby had fried shrimp both were fried really nice and crispy! Okay so little baby said "Guy was right these shrimp gave me a first class trip to flavor town!!" lol when we were leaving she told our server to tell the chief "these are the best shrimp I ever had". NEEDLESS TO SAY SHE LOVED IT!!!  I ordered the crispy rice in a clay pot....uuuummmmm it was good the mushrooms are very earthy so if that's not your thing skip them, the rice was crispy almost burnt tho.....but I think that's how its supposed to be?? and I wish I had bigger plate to mix it in I also added jalapenos  but I honestly think I has pho envy so the whole time I was eating I was wishing it was pho... sad I know... next time I'm gonna go for what I know and have pho fo sho.....lol BBBBBUUUUTTTT when we were waiting to pay I heard someone order brussel sprouts, I've never had them before but I remembered Guy saying they were good so I ordered some to go....once we got settled in the car for the trop home I told little baby to hand me one so I could taste them while they were hot and  I kid you not they were AMAZING!!! I don't know what kinda sauce they used but it was yummy and we ate them all before when got home and that's why there isn't a picture.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crispy rice with tofu
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Marinated shrimp and rice
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried shrimp spring roll

H7AvBKQpYeW88LvP5Z_MmA.text: My first outing was a great experience. This little restaurant tucked away near The Joint and Nekter was a great find.  I tried the crunchy rice pot with tenderloins and I was very happy with the choice. The rice and vegetables were flavorful and the meat was tender.  Even after I'd eaten to satisfaction, the pot still had enough for leftovers.  This moderately priced restaurant will be one of my occasional stop in places.

wCb90VGowgwjx_iqgdl4yA.text: Some of the best Vietnamese food that I have ever had and tucked away in an unassuming strip mall in Scottsdale.  We had a bunch of their vegetarian items from potstickers, garlic edamame, spring rolls, and pho which were all excellent.  I had their grilled chicken and rice plate which was cooked great with just the right amount of burnt places to make the fish sauce balance things out.  My only complaint is that they did not have a high chair for my daughter so my wife had to hang on to her in the booster seat for the entire dinner so she wouldn't slide under the table.  Would recommend skipping the large chain joints in this area to eat at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. This place is on Fieri;)
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charbroil chicken and rice, awesome!

20fuCCG9JO4rMFx4V21LpA.text: By far my favorite Pho joint in Scottsdale! Excellent service, great food, and amazing staff. Always in tune with the customers needs and the food is dynamite! Love me some Slanted Rice.

DKW5r2QM49CyjlFkT_ejHg.text: Awesome food-good choice to stop by for lunch! We will definitely be back if we're here in the area in the near future!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

bjab9mNiP9G9NkmCGGm4xQ.text: Both the service and food are very good. A hot pho was in order with the chilly temperatures so after Yelp search for "Best Pho Restaurants" I was led to Slanted Rice. This was my 2nd visit and hoped for an equally pleasant experience.   First up were the pork riblets. Just as I had remembered, these small but flavorful pieces of fried meat were delicious! They were crunchy, meaty, and just the right amount of fat. Next, we both ordered the combination pho. The portions are a bigger than my favorite pho place (Saigon Pho) but then again, the cost is a bit higher. Nevertheless, the broth is flavorful, and they give you a lot of meat. Both the hubby and I enjoyed the food and the ambiance here. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Combination pho
Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork riblets

NboMnhVBmtzHPrj9yK7SFA.text: Amazing Pho! Ordered the combination Pho. It came out quickly. The soup base was delicious. The beef slices were higher quality cuts and perfectly undercooked to allow the beef to finish cooking in the bowl.  I appreciated that there were also onions in the soup (a few places don't do that). It had the typical assortment on the side of sriracha and hoisin sauce, bean sprouts, limes (very juicy), and mint. The food came out very fast and it was the perfect pick-me-up for when I was feeling a little sick.

wp-nfbQX_PzdMsCLDgluHA.text: Drove 45 min Sunday afternoon with wife after seeing it on DDD Sat night, well worth the drive Guy got this one right! It was fairly busy and patio was full but we were immediately greeted and sat, the server was attentive and food came fast and hot, it's a very clean and inviting dining room with a cool funky bar, we decided we would try a variety of dishes as long as we made the drive out, we tried 6 all spot on, with the exception of one (pot-stickers) little to crispy for us, my wife is Chinese and prefers steamed dumplings as do I, but if you like fried they had nice flavor. The sizzling filet is amazing and the garlic butter wings are a close second as was the fried pork rolls raped in lettuce and mint.   I've read here that some people think this place is a little pricey $ But if the general public knew what it cost to just keep the doors open these days with Licensing, Permits, Inspections, Insurance, Utilities now add in Food cost and the ridiculously high cost of rents today this place is  reasonable for what you get. I know this first hand as all these expenses is what drove me out of my brick & motor location and into a Food Truck. Our bill for 6 dishes was only $55.  But the real Gem of this place and why it gets 5 stars from me is the owner Hue she is as charming as they come, with as busy as they were she never stopped table touching wile taking orders and delivering food, she came to our table many times asking if we were ok or needed anything wile refilling our water glasses and checking to see if we were enjoying are food, when bringing the bill out she sat with my wife and looked up her favorite Chinese restaurant online to recommend to us. Who does that? That's what I call customer service in a time where there is far to little of it. Will definitely be back. I don't post a lot mainly due to lack of time but this place warrants a little of my time to pass my experience on to you..

PcKr-fCup0mKYWLAx8MKnA.text: Great spot for lunch. Great combination pho and Vietnamese coffee. Very friendly staff. Nice bar area for seating.

GxR5jrh0KZYKQorjy8Rvdw.text: Coming from South San Jose in California, I've been spoiled with an abundance of delicious Vietnamese cuisine. I came in during a quiet time around 6pm on a Saturday, and was seated immediately as a result. While it's highly Americanized and overpriced compared to what I'm used to, it's a friendly atmosphere, and my Charbroiled Chicken Vermicelli noodles were delicious. A taste of home! Will definitely come back if I want more Vietnamese food

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Charbroiled Vermicelli Noodles (Bun)

Hfi5Gc5zvtrsmPwVLmaIdQ.text: I love the ambience, the service is a little bit slow. Its not the greatest pho that I had but I love that they're open sundays. price wise they're expensive with the size of bowl they serve.

FIfCg2v_697PvWTNjKhT5w.text: Our visit to the Slanted Rice in Scottsdale was our first experience with Vietnamese Cuisine and what a memorable experience it was! Outstanding service, ambiance   and fresh, delicious food prepared and served in a most appealing way is what you will find there! The lemongrass roasted brussels are a perfect start! So flavorful and roasted with an amazing lemon flair! Hubby had the shrimp rolls served on a stick with a tasty dipping sauce and really enjoyed this appetizer as well! We also sampled the vegetarian and shrimp pho and fell in love with the freshness and flavors of this wonderful soup.   I chose a cold rice vermicelli noodle dish with veggies, fresh mint, cucumbers, lettuce, peanuts and a variety of spices and sauces that you can add and then toss the whole thing together! One word- Amazing!!! I was in total vegetarian Heaven the whole time we were there! My husband had the charbroiled pork and rice which was quite tasty and he really enjoyed it.   The owner came out to chat with us and gave some suggestions on where to visit during our stay, she was adorable and very gracious. We are so glad to have visited this hip, immaculately clean and very well managed spot in beautiful Scottsdale! Of course we are on a quest for more Vietnamese food now that we have returned to Florida and I surely hope that they can stand up to the Slanted Rice!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

tuS01tCSHmjlWF3DPE8PQA.text: I came here with my mom while visiting home. We frequent this center for the restaurants and are never disappointed. Slanted Rice popped up since my last visit and since my parents have adopted it as one of their go-tos.   We were seated quickly and almost immediately ordered. We started with the Dragon Lady Spring Roll. It was mild in flavor and mixed textures perfectly.   I really wanted to try one of their shrimp dishes but opted for the Chicken Crispy Rice Clay Pot. Eating this was an experience! It took a little too long to cool down for a quick lunch, so I probably would recommend it for dinner. The flavor a were phenomenal and the crispness of the rice really made the cool down wait worth it.   Overall, I had a great dining experience. I'm excited to try more on their menu and hope there will be lasting power for Slanted Rice!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken Clay Pot!

ZqcnOvZ66x3va7pyxL4BWA.text: My boyfriend and I come here all the time for date night and we always have such a great experience. The music is never loud or obnoxious like some places, it's very relaxing and chill and the look of it is too. It's very clean, the servers are all very nice and professional (yet personable), and it's the best pho/Asian food in town. And if you're not a big eater (like myself) and you're wanting to order pho I would recommended getting the "slanted sized pho". All of the different kinds of meats are offered for this size and the serving size is about the size of an average soup bowl. It's what I get every time and it's always the perfect amount of food, especially with edamame as an appetizer (the lemon grass edamame is super yummy!!).

KfoQWIKOBWsP47yUP-VyiQ.text: The food here is amazing. I came to Slanted Rice last week with my mom who had always raved about the food, and I wanted to see for myself. We arrived in the late afternoon and sat outside. Our waitress was so nice and attentive and gave us her suggestions for her favorite dishes. We started off with the Dragon Lady spring roll, which was great. For my main dish, I got the Pho with chicken, which was so refreshing! They gave me a large variety of options such as mint, jalepenos, and sauces to add to my pho. My mom got the shaken beef, which was AMAZING. This was probably one of my top 20 favorite dishes of all time. The beef was sweet and perfectly flavored and came in a skillet on a bed of onions. Definitely visit the Slanted Rice next time you are in the mood for Vietnamese food, and make sure you try the shaken beef.

SrXTW8QUaEpfATEhn-aNPw.text: God Bless Yelp! Because of it and it's wonderful members, I was able to find this place. It was very busy when we arrived so we took at a seat at the bar. The bartender was a young gal who was about as OCD as I was. She never touched a bare straw with her fingers and made sure we were taken care of.   There are lots of people that wrote the service was slow, and that may have been the case, but I was busy catching up with my friend so it didn't bother us too much. I've never been to such a "upscale" Vietnamese restaurant. The ambiance was great, the food was delicious and the prices were reasonable.   If I'm back in the area, I'd definitely come back for another visit.

UEzWy_Yk2W6czgEmr_ZvJQ.text: My new favorite restaurant.  Incredible flavors.   Super high quality meat.  Sauces are the key though.   Unique and excellent.  Great vibe and fantastic service.

8IwfsugeWGAWnmdseHidEw.text: Yes, definitely a good choice for quick lunch spot in or near Scottdale area.  Good location and limited  seating for abt 40-50 people. Prices are considerably reasonable in Scottsdale. Highly recommending order : Combination Plate .

wHNE5WJczV9C2dRI227uGQ.text: I just paid $17 for a bowl of plain steak pho plus some veggies to go. The bean sprouts were not fresh and the cilantro looked like it had come out of another person's bowl of used pho. The broth did not really taste like much either. For being in Scottsdale I can understand slightly raised prices but not $17 FOR A BOWL OF BASIC SOUP.  NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN- GO TO SAIGON NITES OR UNPHOGETTABLE FOR NORMAL PRICES & BETTER FOOD!!!!!!!!!!

HHo7XKHj4xDZ49SWfjc5SA.text: Great unique atmosphere, quality food.  Veggie curry was excellent but expensive.  Beef pho was excellent as well.  Pretty expensive menu overall, though happy hour appetizer specials will likely bring me back.

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Slanted size beef pho, vegetable curry w double side salad

mhEfM14f8YgU7Uikq0ZKjQ.text: Cute restaurant with good food. Yellow curry, vermicelli noodles and lemongrass surf and turf were good. Clay pot rice was ok, but not bad. We will probably come back, but only if we are prepared for the potential loud atmosphere. Overall good experience.

Y6I8Vgz7Z3v4U5NWKTVENg.text: Busy with limited seating on Valentines Day but well worth the wait. Extremely friendly staff with great food at a good price.

U5c-elo6Hhhrd9XikmzYMg.text: Best Vietnamese food in the Valley.  Great atmosphere.  The service is great and they also have a small but nice outdoor patio.

T0XU2XOQ5JSl9sTXtiSaAA.text: I'm giving them 3 stars for effort.  The broth was okay. Portion size was good for the soup but only 2 egg rolls were served as an appetizer.  This place is more expensive than a traditional Pho restaurant.  I prefer a more traditional pho.  And I hate the name.

Ej-YEZEZ3Fm6BjBx1CUvEA.text: I'm obsessed with this place. The bar is legit. I always get Pho Togo but tonight I got a glass of wine and and dragon lady spring rolls while sitting with my Togo Pho. I changed my mind last minute and wanted to eat something here. It's busy for a Sunday night in Scottsdale and everyone here seems like a regular or a family/couple who's trying out a new place. The service is great and they all have really fun personalities. I always come here alone. Note to self: bring people and eat ALL of the food.

n2Qa_EnOD-Z5PaRpbv9feQ.text: This place is amazing!! The quality and flavors of the dishes is outstanding. We ordered the calamari and the shrimp appetizer. We also ordered a spring role, it was delicious and so fresh. The Brussel sprouts Were to die for. We also ordered a clay pot to share since we saw it on T.v. , it was also amazing. Definitely a place you need to try!

iZgtQd65jA0spWpdj6SfTg.text: Ok... in the spirit of posting, I HAD to review Slanted Rice. Always fresh and delicious. Good atmosphere. We love this place. The spring rolls are amazing and the vegetarian pho is the best I have ever had - and I lived near Mini Saigon, in Seattle. The staff is attentive and fast - and they welcome kids. The hippest place for mom and dad to grab noodles and enjoy time with our mini pho lovers!

Qj-l29uW6ebQAxM2ALW9Xw.text: Really like the place.  Food is great and everyone is very friendly.  Didn't give them 5 stars because the service is a little slow (seems to be only 2 waitstaff during the lunch rush).

lx2KgQtWB6xFFdwOjVU0cQ.text: Ordered lemon grass rice was not impressed at all, food did not taste good, gravy had too much soya sauce and dish was over salted

KqECDdJ9iAZS-EPKtJaRLw.text: Wish I could give this place a negative star rating.  Can't say how the food was as we never received out order and after 50 minutes left.  I left $5 on the table to cover drinks/egg rolls the waitress came out and I said we're leaving and she said "I'll comp your egg rolls" and pocketed the $5!!  That was not a tip I see this as theft.  I hope the owner/manger checks these reviews  there is a blood heavy girl waitress that needs to be fired.  I have left a message for owner/manager. vbw8eWrBo-rUeovsvtUWIw.text: Slanted Rice is beyond fabulous! Excellent food every time I have been there. Wings and everything on the menu is made fresh to order it is amazing. j_7GQtDx644aA5kVb9DiQQ.text: Really wanted to like this place.  But had a horrendous experience all around... Staff was woefully inept and over their heads.  Food came out 40 minutes later and was burnt & inedible.  We will not be back.  Very sad to see yet another restaurant fail so early...  good luck to them.

7xcydoqKvZ3g47YudR508Q.text: I keep going back to this place to keep trying new things.  The Clay pots and Firecracker Shrimp with garlic noodles (not overly garlicy) are awesome.  The family behind this restaurant from what we were told get thier recipes from thier grandmother and she is on point!  They have several different concepts around the valley.  Other than the name which seems odd the food is legit and I highly recommend it.

5ckB0_fHpCsQd3SQxPPC2w.text: I really enjoy this restaurant, the decor is modern and upscale, the food is great. The chicken in the chicken pho is really flavorful and tender- probably the best I've had compared to any other chicken pho in the Valley. The staff are friendly and attentive, I look forward to each time I visit here.

ef1ZPXxD8W6vubVmu-yVsw.text: My coworker discovered this place & brought me on a recent work trip to AZ. Atmosphere is very sleek and modern, although I will say the nightclub-esque lighting on the ceiling seemed a bit out of place for a place that's open for lunch. Food was good, but a bit bland, which was easily fixed with the variety of spicy sauces they had to offer. We tried the pho, crunchy rice in a clay pot & curry dishes (the vegetarian version of each). Service was friendly & attentive. I'd definitely go back!

Fe3SbBYnlNTPzOYfWubDuQ.text: We went to Slanted Rice this past Friday night. I was excited to go knowing that one of the owners was once the chef at Banzai, a sushi place I used to love on Northern and 12th street (now closed). First off, this place isn't your typical Vietnamese restaurant. It's a little bistro style restaurant with a hip atmosphere and a diverse and edgy menu. We started with lemon grass wings and lemon grass brussel sprouts. The wings were fantastic and the person at the table who hates sprouts was the one who insisted on a second order! For dinner we had the steak and the chicken. The entrees came with a small soup and salad, the soup was pho of course. I frequent Vietnamese restaurants around the valley and I have to say their pho was the most flavourful I've ever had. The steak and chicken were both absolutely delicious. I fairly sure I'm going for the steak again on my next visit. I had a cocktail recommended by the staff, don't know what it was called but they said it was the house signature drink, it was made with Jameson and blueberries. I definitely recommend trying one if you go, it was great. I can't comment on price as we were guests and were treated, but the menu prices looked very reasonable. Even though this place is not near where I live, it's worth the trip, I'll be heading back very soon.

2K2ZQajnl2H595kmyvr3ug.text: Food is very good - a bit higher for Vietnamese but worth it for the venue and the food - love the decor - service a bit slow but they just opened so we will try again - we love this type of fresh Asian food - thanks - we made it to the movie on time for hubby's birthday last Monday.

8nwbTV6HcUXWywlF4Io6_w.text: Frequently do take-out from here. Food is excellent. Love the salad and soup that comes with the meals. Shaken beef is my favorite! The PHO is awesome as well! Fast service and very friendly staff. Highly recommend.

wwkv4m6XCRA6_3qqyvgIwQ.text: Giving Slanted Rice even one star is being generous.  I had heard such great things about Slanted Rice and love Vietnamese food so friends took me for my bday.  We had brussel sprouts  and edamame a la lemongrass ... both were very sweet and sticky.  As my main, I had the clay rice pot with tofu and veggies.  The tofu was disgusting - chewy and tough - like it had been cooked and then microwaved to heat it up.  I mentioned it to our waiter who brought the owner over.  She explained that they use firm tofu and proceeded to tell me about the different kinds of tofu.  No apology was offered, nor was the dish offered to be removed from the bill.  She didn't apologize.  I asked for rice with veggies which took forever to come out.  The dish had about 2 cups of rice and 1/2 cup of veggies - again, smothered in a sweet sauce.  My friends ordered tofu and chicken - both said they were spongy, touch and chewy.   I eat tofu all the time and have never tasted tofu so poorly prepared.   Totties, Malee's on Main and Saigon Nights all have delicious tofu.  NONE of them serve chewy, spongy,  tofu.  The soup that come with the meal was salty.  The salad was basically wilted lettuce.  The restaurant knew it was my birthday.  They didn't offer us dessert. - not that I was looking for a free-bee - they never even brought a dessert menu giving us a chance to order.  All around I had a very poor experience.  And, the prices were extremely high.  Rice with a few veggies $14.    Seriously!?   I won't be going back and neither will the two other friends I want with.

bkODGyKOOp-GdHYJ3RBq-A.text: What is not to love!  The ingredients are fresh. The spices and herbs so fresh you can smell the wonderful aromas as they set it in front of you. Pleasing to the eye, the nose and the taste buds. Cannot wait to come back again SOON and try everything on menu.

g9ca1QohXe7WGRvqEFb9cQ.text: Outstanding service but food quality is inconsistent. I've eaten there several times and sometimes it's excellent and others its average at best. A couple times I had very overcooked shrimp (almost burnt) and noodles had a stale taste. Very nice servers and management. I wish them the best but they need more oversight of the kitchen which I think is cutting corners.

JENXHby9uVcdO3w9poo69w.text: great food.  great ambiance.  a little pricey but definitely worth it.  this is my go to place for vietnamese!

MzL_oKp3aBZZgMT9CRjAYQ.text: It's pho'ing awesome! We're regulars. Love the owners.   Great happy hour on awesome food.   Leave feeling full by not gross.   Must try if you like any Asian cuisine,  you'll be an instant convert.

1OhvLLZYUDAMffTtb1ry1w.text: Excellent dinner!  Just went with a group and really enjoyed the ambiance and the food.  We shared drinks (interesting list of specialty drinks) and caught the end of happy hour.  As our appetizers, we ordered the spring rolls served with peanut sauce and edamame with 2 sauces (lemongrass was my favorite) - very fresh and tasty.  For entrees we shared garlic noodles and shrimp, the caramelized salmon and crispy rice with shrimp in clay pots, and lemongrass chicken.  The dishes are all served with a side salad and a bowl of broth (pho) for mixing in sauces.  It was all very fresh tasting and delicious.  They also have a nice outdoor patio and appears dog-friendly.  We will go back!

POoxIjIIf7EOgIxRno3aDw.text: This was the most unique restaurant I have ever been at. It had amazing flavors and I wanted to try everything. The best part was the serves, the owner herself served us and was extremely friendly. I would recommend to anyone and everyone and I will be going back soon!

ElYqlUXUpgpzTm19DFI01w.text: The atmosphere is very warm and friendly. This would be a great date night place. The food was very good and served piping hot. Loved this place and will be back to try something else.

V2IcQQRZZ-xyuWgaBA_EzQ.text: Make sure you eat there! If you order to go you will get treated like a complete different person. They first off lie to you by telling you it'll be well over an hour for a to go order when it's dead inside so you will eat there. And the bartenders are very rude to you while you wait for you sit and wait for your order.  It's unfortunate because the food was good but we will not be going back after how awful the service was. Gave it a couple tries and it was the same. Hope they work on it.

H8TK3mVxeTq2pmHvqIvFEg.text: Great little place while out shopping in Scottsdale ! Happen to be visiting a friend nearby - try the clay pot - lemongrass stir fry & of course the PHO !!

ZdVpFZz3Ne-welYMSwZNfg.text: Came here last night and we were very impressed with the service and food. I love that they have a smaller portion size of pho--about 1/4 to 1/3 of the traditional size pho (just $6). Most places don't do that! It was just the right size for me. They also have a lot of other things on the menu that I want to try so I'll definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Slanted Rice Vietnamese Bistro - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 2nd time back in a week. Charbroiled pork rice vermicelli was so good! Lots of veggies.

ja01d3b19P1VbdRyI4-7zg.text: If you are looking for a high-scale Vietnamese dining, this is your place. Food is tasty! The reason for the two star rating is the service: an Asian lady who works at the bar was not particularly welcoming and was pretty condescending. With the price you are paying for the good, you'd expect better service.

kBi_cBy2Fvv6zNtVeQCd5Q.text: It time for me to right a well deserved review for slanted rice.  I come here every time I visit but last week I moved here.    Consistently amazing food !!!!
